title.rendered: Lady Fatemah Zahra (s) – The Resplendent Light

content.rendered:
The entire universe belongs to Allah the Almighty. He does what He wishes. None can curtail His Power and Authority. Importantly, Allah has appointed the infallible Imams (peace be upon them) as the medium of all His Beneficence and Blessings. On this premise, the infallible Imams (peace be upon them) can possess anything in the universe. Our responsibility is that we acquire recognition of these honorable ones, who have been granted power and authority over the heavens and the earth by Allah.

Besides, if we wish to live a blissful life and stay on the straight path, it is essential to differentiate between truth and falsehood. These honorable ones mirror Allah’s pleasure and displeasure. In their happiness lies Allah’s happiness, in their anger is Allah’s anger. Allah is obeyed through their obedience and disobeyed if they are defied. Therefore, it is obligatory for us to gain their recognition which in the end will become the reason for our prosperity and success.

The Status of Hazrat Zahra (peace be upon her) is beyond being virtuous

The position of Hazrat Zahra (peace be upon her) is way higher than just being virtuous.

Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) informs: Surely, Allah is happy when Fatemah is happy and angry when Fatemah is angry.

(Behaar al-Anwaar v 30, p. 353; Al-Mustadrak Alaa Al-Sahihain v 3, p. 154; Al-Mojam al-Kabeer v 22, p. 401; Saheeh al-Bukhaari v 5, p. 83)

This tradition makes it clear that the status of Janabe Zahra (peace be upon her) is far superior to just being virtuous because chastity means that every action of a person” his contentment or discontentment, happiness, and anger is as per Allah wish. He is content in Allah’s pleasure and angry in Allah’s anger. His actions are a reflection of Allah’s wish.  But, this isn’t the case with Janabe Zahra (peace be upon her) because here Allah is pleased with what Janabe Fatemah Zahra (peace be upon her) is pleased with and angered with what she is angered.

It is impossible to recognise Hazrat Zahra (peace be upon her)

Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) says:

Fatemah was named Fatemah because the entire creation was helpless in recognizing her.

(Behaar al-Anwaar vol 43 p. 65)

The words of the tradition are worth pondering. Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) has emphasized on entire creation which barring Allah, includes not only mortals but even the honorable carrier of divine revelation, trustworthy of Allah, Janabe Jibraeel, Izraael, other proximate angels, the Greater Prophets, the Noble Messengers, and the vicegerents.

How great must be that pious being who even the trustworthy Jibraeel cannot fully understand? Even the Prophets (a.s.) cannot gain her true recognition. This great being can be comprehended in its entirety only by Allah.

In this regard, let us look at the Holy Prophets’ (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) narration:

When the representatives of Allah will settle in rows (during the Day of Judgement) at that moment Adam (peace be upon him) and other prophets (peace be upon them) will come for your visitation.

(Behaar al-Anwaar, vol. 43 p. 22)

Indeed, what an eminent position it is for all the Prophets (peace be upon them) to stand in rows and call on Hazrat Fatemah Zahra (peace be upon her). The human mind fails to grasp the prominence Allah has conferred upon this great lady.

Surely, none can perceive the greatness of the lady who will have Prophets (peace be upon them) lining up to call on her in paradise. As it is the minds fail to fathom the status of Prophets (peace be upon them), so how is it possible to realize the position of one who will be visited by rows of Prophets (peace be upon them)?

Creation of Hazrat Zahra (peace be upon her)

The following narration has been reported by both the Shias and Bakris. It is so authentic from the reliability point of view that a fatwa can be delivered on its basis.

Imam Jafar al-Sadiq (peace be upon him) informs: The noble Messenger (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) would kiss Hazrat Zahra (peace be upon her) a lot. When Ayesha objected saying: O Messenger of Allah, what is the reason behind you kissing Fatemah so much?

The Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) replied:

When I ascended to the heavens (Meraaj), I visited paradise. From the tress of paradise, I saw a tree that was better than all the other trees. There was no tree whiter or more fragrant than this one. I took one fruit from this tree. This fruit took the shape of a fluid in my loin and when I returned to earth I transferred what was given to me in trust into Khadija’s womb from which Fatemah was formed. Therefore, whenever I am desirous of smelling paradise, I smell Fatemah.

(Behaar al-Anwaar, vol 18 p. 315; Al-Durr al-Mansoor vol 4 p. 153; Al Mojam al Kabeer vol 22 p. 401; Tafseer Noor al-Saqalain, vol 3, p. 98)

It is worth noting that Hazrat Muhammad Mustafa (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) is the most excellent and the most honorable among all the prophets, messengers, and obviously, the entire creation. The purest of places is paradise and from this paradise the most special tree and from this exclusive tree the best fruit. From here begins the pure existence of Hazrat Fatemah Zahra (peace be upon her) and this creation is physical creation. Meaning, the thing from which Hazrat Zahra’s (peace be upon her) body was formed was from the most beautiful of fruits.

Relation of the body with the soul

From the Quranic point of view, the body and soul have one relation. On the creation of Hazrat Adam (peace be upon him), the Holy Quran says:

So when I have made him complete and breathed into him of My Spirit…

(Surah Hijr (15): Verse 29)

In another place it is mentioned:

Certainly, We created man in the best form.

(Surah Teen (95): Verse 4)

No creation is better than humans. Man’s remarkable features and the form of his body are suitable and worthy for a soul to be breathed into it. Thus, the soul is only infused when the body is deserving of it. This means that all bodies of the world are not worthy enough for life to be breathed into it. When all bodies cannot possess a regular soul; a body other than the regular one is required for someone with the special beneficence of Allah

The body made of worldly material is deserving of a soul to be infused into it and that too a soul which is connected to Allah. For which, Allah says, It’s His Spirit. So, for that sacred body, which was formed after eating a fruit from heaven, what kind of soul would be required for it? When this sacred body is different from all bodies of the world, the soul in it, too, will be different from others.

Perhaps, on this basis, the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) informs: The Almighty Allah created her from His resplendent light. When this light dazzled the entire universe was lit up. The eyes of the angels were bedazzled; they fell down in prostration to Allah. They said, “O Lord! What is this light? Allah sent a revelation: This light is from My Light. I have given it space in My Heavens. I have created this from My Grandeur. Through My Prophets, I will make it appear in the loin of a Prophet, who will be superior to all the other Prophets. Then, from this light, I will create My Imams, who will arise on My command and will guide people towards My rights. After the culmination of revelations, I will appoint them as My vicegerents of earth.

(Behaar al-Anwaar vol 43 p. 12)

This is how the pure body of Hazrat Fatemah Zahra (peace be upon her) was created with the best fruit from Paradise and Allah created her soul from His resplendent light. If there was so much grandeur accompanying this light to come into this materialistic world then what rank it will have in the hereafter?

Imam Sadiq (peace be upon him) quotes Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny): Before the creation of the sky and earth, Allah created the light of Hazrat Fatemah Zahra (peace be upon her).

The Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) was asked, O Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) – is she not a human? He (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) replied Fatemah is a human fairy.

He (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) was asked, How is she a human fairy?

The Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) replied Allah created her from His light before He created Hazrat Adam (peace be upon him). At the time there were only souls. When Hazrat Adam (peace be upon him) was created, this light was placed in front of him.

He (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) was asked, Where was Fatemah then?

He (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) replied, In a treasure under the Arsh.

He (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) was asked, What was her provision?

He (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) informed, Praising and glorifying Allah was her nourishment.

(Behaar al-Anwaar vol 43, p. 4)

Hazrat Fatemah Zahra’s (peace be upon her) Worship

At the end of this narration, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) informs that in the world of souls, under the Arsh (Throne), Hazrat Fatemah Zahra’s (peace be upon her) nourishment was praising and glorifying Allah, which is commonly referred to as the Tasbeeh of Fatemah Zahra (peace be upon her) and hence, the terminology heavenly tasbeeh.

The light of Hazrat Zahra (peace be upon her) was preserved in the treasures of Arsh; her food was praising and glorifying Allah. Likewise in this world, she would be so engrossed in worship in the prayer-niche that her feet would become swollen.

There was none in this nation who would worship more than Fatemah (peace be upon her). She would stand and worship so much that her feet would swell.

(Al-Manaaqeb of Ibne Shahr Aashoob vol 3 p. 389)

Her worship in this world points towards the fact that she continued to praise and glorify Allah in the same vein as she did in the world of souls.

Imam Sadiq (as_ informs, The one who is fortunate to gain the real recognition of Hazrat Fatemah Zahra (peace be upon her) then he has discovered (the real) Night of Destiny (Shab-e-Qadr).

(Behaar al-Anwaar vol 43 p. 66; Tafseer al-Furaat p. 581)

Hazrat Fatemah Zahra (peace be upon her) is a part of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him and his holy progeny)

One day the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) stepped out of his house holding Hazrat Fatemah Zahra’s (peace be upon her) hand and he asserted, Those who know her recognize her. Those who don’t recognize her ” she is Fatemah b. Muhammad. She is part of me. She is my heart. She is the soul between my sides. Who displeases her has displeased me and whoever displeases me displeases Allah.

(Behaar al-Anwaar vol 43 p. 54)

In light of this tradition, Hazrat Fatemah Zahra (peace be upon her) is a part of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny). Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) did not say that she is a part of my body. Instead, he (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) said she is a part of my entity. She is a part of Prophethood and Messengership. Her soul is associated with the Holy Prophet’s (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) heart.

The heart of Allah’s Messenger (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) is not an ordinary heart. Rather, it is the center of all sciences, from the first to the last. It encompasses complete knowledge of all Prophets (peace be upon them) and vicegerents (peace be upon them). Hazrat Fatemah Zahra (peace be upon her) is a reflection of all these sciences and realities.

The Companion’s Behavior with Hazrat Fatemah (peace be upon her)

In view of Hazrat Fatemah Zahra (peace be upon her) greatness and keeping in mind the extraordinary traditions of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) in this regard, one question haunts the Muslim community – how did the companions of Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) behave with her after his (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) demise?

The answer to this question is presented by history. The following incident is noteworthy:

When the usurpers of the caliphate (which was the right of Ameerul Momineen Ali b. Abi Talib (peace be upon him)) arrived at his house and demanded that he step out, Imam Ali (peace be upon him) initially wanted to address them. But Hazrat Fatemah Zahra (peace be upon her) stopped him and she herself attended the door. This was when Umar had come to forcefully take allegiance to Abu Bakr. When Ali (a.s.) did not step out as expected, Umar exclaimed, I swear by the One who has my life in His hand, if you do not submit him (Imam Ali (peace be upon him)) to us, I will burn down the house along with its inmates.

At this threat, his own companions alerted him, O Abu Hafs (i.e. Umar) Fatemah is inside the house.

Umar said indifferently, So what!

(Al-Imamah wa Al-Siyasah vol 1 p. 19)

Reacting to this, Hazrat Fatemah (peace be upon her) said, I haven’t seen more shameless and ill-mannered people than you. You have abandoned the sacred body of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) and gathered over here to usurp our rights!

(Al-Imamah wa Al-Siyasah vol 1 p. 19)

These are those who grew under the tutelage of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) and their status was rooted in the companionship of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny). They were recognized in society as Holy Prophets (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) companions. Despite this, they abandoned his (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) revered corpse and rushed to decide the matter of caliphate lest it eludes them. Not content with bagging the caliphate, they set fire to the house of the Prophet’s (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) beloved daughter, the Chief of all women of Paradise, whose excellence was repeatedly highlighted by the Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny).

It is amazing how the companions had changed so dramatically in two to three days. These were the same companions who congregated behind the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) in his mosque for prayers and heard his sermons with rapt attention. After the Prophets (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) demise, it was as if they were never his companions, with the cold-heartedness they displayed towards the Prophets (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) brother and daughter.

The Calamities befalling Hazrat Fatemah Zahra (peace be upon her)

Saeed b. Jubair narrates from Ibne Abbas: One day the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) was sitting when Imam Hasan (peace be upon him) entered. He (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) welcomed him and delightfully seated him on his right lap. Then Imam Hussain (peace be upon him) entered. He (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) welcomed him and seated him on his left lap. Then Hazrat Fatemah Zahra (peace be upon her) came and sat alongside Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny). After that Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) came and sat on the right of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny).

Then the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) began weeping incessantly.

Someone asked: O Messenger of Allah! What has caused you grief?

Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) then revealed their virtues and the sufferings they would face in his absence. When the discussion reached Hazrat Zahra (peace be upon her), after elucidating her virtues, he (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) said: When I see her, I remember the afflictions that will befall her after me.

(Al-Amali of Shaikh Sadooq (r.a.) Majlis 24 p. 99; Behaar al-Anwaar vol. 28 p. 37)

The Sunni scholars have also reported this tradition in Faraaed al-Simtain vol. 2 p. 25

Have the Muslims forgotten to pay attention to the tradition despite reporting it? If in Janabe Fatemahs (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) happiness lies Allah’s happiness and in her anger lies Allah’s anger, then what is the status of those who oppressed her?

When Abu Bakr and Umar visited Hazrat Zahra (peace be upon her) in the aftermath of the incident which left her grievously injured, she warned them, I take Allah and the angels as witnesses and declare that you two have angered me and displeased me.

(Al-Imamah wa Al-Siyasah vol 1 p. 20)

Is not Hazrat Zahra’s (peace be upon her) anger the cause of Allah’s anger and His messengers (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) anger? Moreover, hasn’t the one who angered Hazrat Zahra (peace be upon her) deviated from the right path? Some Muslims are of the view that we shouldn’t narrate such incidents as whatever has transpired has transpired and there is no benefit in recounting these issues now. By the same logic, half the Quran should be abandoned because it is a mere narration of incidents that have transpired with no benefit for Muslims at present.

It is necessary not only to narrate incidents revolving around the Prophet’s (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) rightful successor but also to investigate those who prevented the truth from prevailing and misled the masses. This is necessary so that we pursue goodness and refrain from evil. This is also one of the reasons for repeated narrations in the Holy Quran of the past prophets and their nations.

Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) foresaw this incident when he informed, As if I am present at that time and witnessing how lowly and despicable characters are entering this house (of Hazrat Zahra (peace be upon her)).

What can be more offensive than the fact that ill-mannered people are at the door wanting to set the house on fire? Can there be anything more offensive and infuriating for Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) than to watch his wife being felled by the door and being fatally wounded so much so that her ribs were left fractured, eventually departing from this world due to the injury?

The following incident is notable:

Ibn Abi al-Hadid al-Motazali” a famous Sunni scholar writes, One day I recounted the incident of the conquest of Makkah and Habbar ibn Aswad in front of my teacher Abu Jafar Naqeet. Following the conquest of Makkah, the Messenger (peace be upon him and his holy progeny), despite being a mercy for the worlds, had declared the killing of certain people as permissible. One among them was Habbar b. Aswad. The cause for this was traced to the migration of Muslims to Madinah. When the ladies from Prophets (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) family were migrating to Madinah from Makkah, among them was the Prophets (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) foster daughter Zainab. Habbar had cast a spear toward her which killed her child. In Holy Prophets (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) view the crime was so gruesome that he had made the blood of Habbar b. Aswad permissible.

Ibn Abi al-Hadid recounts: My teacher Abu Jafar Naqeet said, If the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) were alive then wouldn’t he have declared as permissible the blood of those who had terrorized and threatened Hazrat Fatemah Zahra (peace be upon her) which eventually claimed the life of her unborn child Mohsin?

(Sharh-o-Nahj al-Balaaghah of Ibn Abi Â al-Hadid, vol. 3 p. 35)

Now, take a look at the statement of Shams al-Deen al-Zahabi (exp. 748 A.H.), a reliable Sunni scholar, recorded in his book Mizaan al-Etedaal Umar pushed Fatemah with so much force that it resulted in Mohsins death.

(Mizaan al-Etedaal vol. 1 p. 139)

Abu Baseer (r.a.) relates ” I asked Imam Jafar Sadiq (peace be upon him): Why did Hazrat Fatemah Zahra (peace be upon her) depart from this world at such a young age?

He (peace be upon him) replied: She was martyred young because Umars slave, Qunfooz, acting on Umar’s orders, attacked Hazrat Zahra (peace be upon her) so harshly with the sheath of his sword that Mohsin was killed. This injury left Janabe Zahra (peace be upon her) very weak (from which she never recovered).

(Dalaael al-Imamah p. 134)

title.rendered: Importance of Ayyam-e-Fatimiyyah

content.rendered:
The days commemorating the martyrdom of Lady Fatima Zahra (peace be upon her) – the beloved daughter of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) – are known as ‘Ayyam-e-Fatimiyyah’.

The Ayyam are observed from the 13th/14th Jamadi al-Awwal to the 3rd Jamadi al-Aakhar.

Why Ayyam-e-Fatimiyyah

We observe the Ayyam to mourn the distressing circumstances surrounding the martyrdom of Lady Fatima Zahra (peace be upon her) and her son Mohsin Ibn Ali (peace be upon him) during the attack on her house after the Prophet’s (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) martyrdom.

We consider mourning Lady Fatima Zahra (peace be upon her) in her Ayyam as our duty, bigger than even mourning Imam Husain (peace be upon him) in Muharram.

The attack on the house of Lady Fatima Zahra (peace be upon her) is more painful for Aal Muhammad (peace be upon them) than Karbala.

As Imam Jafar Sadiq (peace be upon him) informed – There is no greater difficulty for us than the Day of Karbala even though it was like the Day of Saqifah and the burning down the door on Ali – Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) and Fatima (peace be upon her) and Hasan (peace be upon him) and Husain (peace be upon him) and Zainab (peace be upon her) and Umm Kulsum (peace be upon her) and Fizza and the killing of Muhassin (Mohsin) (peace be upon him) with a kick is greater and more bitter because it laid the foundation for the Day (of Ashoora).

  • Hidayah al-Kubra p 417

Then the heat in the hearts of the believer for Imam Husain (peace be upon him) that will never cool must burn even more intensely for Lady Fatima Zahra (peace be upon her).

Condolence to Holy Prophet (s.a.w.a.)

Among the biggest reasons to mourn the martyrdom of Lady Fatima (peace be upon her) over an extended period is because she was the beloved daughter of the Prophet of Islam (peace be upon him and his holy progeny).

Our success and deliverance in this world and the hereafter rests solely on our belief in Islam for which we must frequently thank Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) for his efforts.

Basic bounties like food and clothing should be recompensed by thanking the benefactor, often our own parents. Then what should be our compensation for the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) who has granted us all worldly and other-worldly bounties?

It is narrated that for the one who recites the following daily, Allah will raise 70 scribes to write good deeds for the reciter till Judgment Day:

جَزَى اللَّهُ‏ مُحَمَّداً ص عَنَّا مَا هُوَ أَهْلُه

May Allah reward Muhammad (s.a.w.a.) from our side to the extent he deserves.

  • Behar al-Anwar v 87 p 7

The Noble Quran informs us on another way to thank Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny):

قُلْ‏ لا أَسْئَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ أَجْراً إِلَّا الْمَوَدَّةَ فِي الْقُرْبى‏

Say: I do not ask of you any reward for it but love for my near relatives…

  • Surah Shura (42): 23

It is not our objective to delve into the definition of ‘near relatives’ over here, suffice to say that according to the interpretation of various Muslim scholars it refers to Ali (peace be upon him), Lady Fatima (peace be upon her) and their infallible sons ending in Imam Mahdi (may Allah hasten his noble reappearance).

One of the ways to thank the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) regarding his ‘near relatives’ is by partaking in their grief and sorrow and in this way helping them in these difficult moments.

Regarding mourning Imam Husain (peace be upon him), Imam Jafar Sadiq (peace be upon him) informs:
There is none who cries (over Imam Husain (peace be upon him)) but that his crying reaches Lady Fatima (peace be upon her) and he supports her in her lamentation, and his crying also reaches the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) and in this way, he fulfils our rights.

  • Kamil al-Ziyarat p 81
  • Behar al-Anwar v 45 p 207
  • Mustadrak al-Wasail v 10 p 314

The reward of mourning the martyrdom of Lady Fatima (peace be upon her) carries similar rewards, if not even more, given that she is the most proximate person to Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) along with Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him). So, their martyrdom is a bigger setback for Islam and Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) and hence mourning Lady Fatima (peace be upon her) and Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) carries maximum reward and is a means to offer condolence to Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny).

Safeguarding the rights of Aal-e-Muhammad (a.s.)

Ayyam-e-Fatimiyyah is about mourning the lady who was at the forefront of safeguarding Prophethood and Imamate and it is about imbibing this stand in our own lives against the attacks on Prophethood and Imamate.

Regarding the exegesis of the Quranic verse:

وَأَمَّا الْجِدَارُ فَكَانَ لِغُلَامَيْنِ يَتِيمَيْنِ فِي الْمَدِينَةِ وَكَانَ تَحْتَهُ كَنزٌ لَّهُمَا وَكَانَ أَبُوهُمَا صَالِحًا

‘And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and there was beneath it a treasure belonging to them, and their father was a righteous man…’ (Surah Kahf (18): 82)

Imam Zainul Abideen (peace be upon him) declared: My father (peace be upon him) narrated from his ancestors (a.s.) – the two orphan boys were ten generations after their righteous father.

While we are the progeny of the Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny). Safeguard us (our rights) for the sake of Allah’s Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny)

The narrator says – I saw people in all directions weeping on this narration.

  • Kashf al-Ghummah vol 1 pg 51

Then it is for the Shias of Lady Fatima Zahra (peace be upon her) in all eras to do their utmost to safeguard the rights of Aal-e-Muhammad (peace be upon them). And one of the ways to achieve this is to commemorate Ayyam-e-Fatimiyyah with the zest and vigour it deserves.

In this mourning period we must answer the pleas of Lady Fatima (peace be upon her) that went unanswered during the attack on the house and in the Sermon of Fadak in the mosque of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny), as Ibn Abbas reports:

Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) informed:
…it is as if I see grief and anxiety entering my daughter’s house, her respect being violated, her rights being usurped, her inheritance being denied to her, her unborn being miscarried, and (in this moment of distress) she will call out – O Muhammad, but no one replies to her pleas.

  • Faraid al-Simtain v 2 p 35

Responsibilities during Ayyam-e-Fatimiyyah

We must evoke memories of the difficulties of Lady Fatima Zahra (peace be upon her) and pray for the earliest reappearance of Imam Mahdi (may Allah hasten his noble reappearance).

All related events like her martyrdom, violent attack on her house that saw her being bodily harmed, resulting in the martyrdom of the unborn Mohsin Ibn Ali (peace be upon him), usurping of Fadak, Sermon of Fadak, and its arguments, etc must be propagated widely.

We must be in a state of mourning (azadari) over the period like we mourn Imam Husain (peace be upon him) in Muharram. Black clothing, mourning assemblies, and processions should mark the period of mourning.

Dedicated effort must be made to publicize the Sermon of Fadak and memorize it.

The great Shiite scholar and jurist – Ayatullah Sayyed Shihab al-Deen Marashi Najafi (r.a.) in his will to his son:

O son, there is a memorable speech by Sayyidah Tahirah – Fatima (peace be upon her) which she delivered in the Prophet’s (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) mosque in front of the Muslims. Even scholars and proficient linguists have failed to understand it fully. Reflect on her words and try to understand them.

  • Shihab al-Shariah p 366

In Ayyam-e-Fatimiyyah the Muslim community must be guided towards the correct belief of Imamate and Fadak with proper arguments because this is the reason the Lady of Light (peace be upon her) underwent so many difficulties. Else, it was the easiest thing for her to annihilate the enemies with a simple curse.

Ayyam-e-Fatimiyyah serves as a wake-up call delivered by Lady Fatima (peace be upon her) to the Muslims every year, to revive her struggle against the Satanic forces that irreparably damaged Islam, which will be reformed only with the advent of her last son, the Promised Mahdi (may Allah hasten his noble reappearance).

title.rendered: Why Ameerul Momineen (a) did not avenge the killing of Fatima Zahra (s)

content.rendered:
The skeptic’s intent behind this line of questioning is to deny the attacks. If there had been an attack, Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) would certainly have avenged the killing. Since he (peace be upon him) did not avenge, there was no attack.

Reply

Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) did not retaliate based on Prophet’s (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) bidding to be patient in face of oppression and lack of support. He (peace be upon him) placed a higher priority on avoiding factionalism in Islam and preventing hypocrites from gaining upper hand, rather than retaliating for a seemingly personal grievance.

Also, avenging and retaliation are from the traits of the Arabic pre-Islamic era while Islam preaches patience and forbearance to the extent possible, with the promise of greater reward for the oppressed and greater chastisement for the oppressor.

This means the more prolonged the oppression, the greater the reward and punishment for the oppressed and oppressor, respectively. By not retaliating Ali (peace be upon him) and Fatima Zahra (peace be upon her) are oppressed to date and are being rewarded continuously and their oppressors are likewise being punished continuously.

Quran was the guiding light for the Ahle Bait (peace be upon them) which says:
And if you take your turn, then retaliate with the like of that with which you were afflicted; but if you are patient, it will certainly be best for those who are patient. (Suran Nahl (16): 126)

There are many instances when Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) likewise did not avenge or retaliate even for profoundly serious crimes.

  1. Wahshi, the killer of Hamza, was left unpunished by Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny). Muawiyah Ibn Mugheerah Ibn Abil Aas, the one who desecrated Hamza’s corpse was given three days to vacate Medina. Retaliation against Wahshi should have been natural for the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) who was terribly upset at seeing the mutilated corpse of his beloved uncle, but he chose patience after Allah revealed the verse at that stage:
    And if you take your turn, then retaliate with the like of that with which you were afflicted; but if you are patient, it will certainly be best for those who are patient.(Surah Nahl (16): 126)
  2. Khalid Ibn Walid wiped out an entire tribe (Bani Jazimah) of newly converted Muslims due to an old rivalry dating to the pre-Islamic period. The Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) showed his anger by repeatedly dissociating himself from Khalid’s action without punishing Khalid. Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) settled the matter with blood money by sending Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him). (Sahih Bukhari book 64, trad 368)
  3. In the incident of Aqabah, the Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) faced a deadly attack from over a dozen hypocrites. Not only did the Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) let them get away, but he did not even publicly name them – he (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) identified the attackers only to Huzaifa and even then, warned him from revealing their identities. This was to prevent problems in Islamic society at a later stage. When the Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) was told to name the hypocrites and punish them, he (peace be upon him and his holy progeny): I don’t like people to say – first Muhammad places his hand in the hands of companions, then names them as conspirators. (Majma al-Bayan v 5 p 68 under Tafseer of Surah Tauba (9): 74)So when Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) did not retaliate for an attack on him when he had all the support and the entire Muslim army behind him, it is not surprising if Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) likewise did not retaliate for the attack on Fatima Zahra (peace be upon her) when he (peace be upon him) was alone with no supporters. In fact, non-retaliation was the natural course of action for Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him).
  4. Abu Sufyan, Muawiyah, Amr Aas who for years had tormented the Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) were left unpunished even when Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) had the opportunity to punish them.

Likewise, the Ahle Bait (peace be upon them) did not retaliate, rather they overlooked their oppressors on the Sunnah of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) and for the same reasons – to avoid conflict in religion and for the divine promised of greater reward for patience:

  1. In the battle of Jamal, Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) spared Marwan who had been captured and did not even demand that Marwan pay allegiance. He (peace be upon him) also sent Prophet’s wife back to Medina. Rebelling against the caliph of the time was punishable by death, but Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) overlooked it.
  2. Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) did not take back Fadak (which is another objection of the skeptics) because till the time Fatima Zahra (peace be upon her) was deprived of Fadak she was oppressed and was being rewarded and Abu Bakr was an oppressor and was being punished and Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) did not wish to disturb both these sequences.
  3. Even for his own killer Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) laid a rule that he was to be killed with a single stroke if he (peace be upon him) dies, which suggests that had Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) survived the fatal blow, he may have overlooked punishing Abdul Rahman. Also, he (peace be upon him) stressed Abdul Rahman’s body was not to be mutilated.
  4. Imam Husain (peace be upon him) did not retaliate against Ayesha and Marwan for attacking the bier of Imam Hasan (peace be upon him) with arrows.

All these examples show that non-retaliation was the norm for Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) and Ahle Bait (peace be upon them) and just because there was no retaliation for Fatima Zahra (peace be upon her) killing it does not mean there was no attack.

title.rendered: Why Hazrat Zahra (s) demanded Fadak from the government

content.rendered:
Hazrat Fatemah Zahra (peace be upon her) (the chief of all women in Paradise) was least interested in worldly possessions. She being a lady of exalted disposition, enjoyed great spiritual status and this was well-acknowledged by the Islamic world. She had all along remained aloof from the world and was wary of its trappings and deceit. However, after the Prophet’s (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) demise, she agitated against the government to assert her claim over Fadak.

What brought about this change in her outlook to worldly possessions after snubbing them all her life? Why after recognizing the world for what it is “more worthless than a goat’s sneeze or the bone of a pig in the hand of a leper or lighter than the wing of a fly”, did she embark on a prolonged struggle with the government over a piece of property?

What factors made her bear untold hardships, affliction, and troubles in her crusade against the government? Were a small piece of land and a few date trees worth so much trouble? After all, she was fully aware that all her efforts would eventually be in vain, and the government would not return the land to her. It is natural for conscious readers to raise such questions regarding Hazrat Fatemah Zahra’s (peace be upon her) anguished demand for Fadak.
The questions are not complex for students of Islamic history, particularly for those who have closely studied the events in the immediate aftermath of the Holy Prophet’s (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) demise. A cursory analysis of these events will provide the readers with the answers they are seeking.

The first and primary reason was that Fadak was usurped to deprive Hazrat Fatemah Zahra (peace be upon her) of her lawful property and thus financially weaken the progeny of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him and his holy progeny). Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) was already facing opposition in his claim for caliphate; by withholding the property of Fadak, an attack was being inflicted by the government to weaken him economically. It was anticipated by the government that the people would see Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) as financially weak and would disregard his claim to the caliphate. In the process, they wanted to dent his social and religious status. This was the very tactic adopted by the hypocrites with regard to the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) in the early era of Islam, who had imposed economic sanctions against all the companions and helpers of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny), thereby aiming to weaken him (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) and his mission.

The second reason was that the income of Fadak was substantial. According to Ibn Abil Hadeed al-Mutazali, the number of date trees in Fadak was equal to the total number of date trees in Kufa. Allama Majlisi (r.a.) quotes from ‘Kashf al-Muhajja’, the annual income of Fadak was 24,000 dinars. Another tradition says that the income was 70,000 dinars. The disparity in the amounts could be a result of fluctuation in the computation of income over the years. Obviously, such a significant amount did not escape the government’s attention, especially since the Hashimites were the beneficiaries.

The third reason was that the demand of Fadak had a direct bearing on the demand of her illustrious husband, Ali Ibn Abi Taalib (peace be upon him) for the caliphate. To substantiate this point, it is worthwhile to delve into an incident involving the renowned scholar Ibn Abil Hadeed al-Mutazali. The latter was studying at Madrasah al-Arabiyyah in Baghdad when he once asked the teacher Ali b. al-Faraqi whether Fatemah (peace be upon her) was truthful.

The teacher answered, “Of course.”

“Then why did Abu Bakr, who knew she (peace be upon her) was truthful, not return Fadak to her?” shot back the zealous student.

The teacher smiled and responded: “If Abu Bakr had conceded Fadak to Fatemah (peace be upon her) based on her pleas, she would have claimed that caliphate is the right of my husband which Abu Bakr had usurped. Under the circumstances, Abu Bakr would not have any excuse for denying Ali his right to caliphate (since he had already conceded Fatemah’s (peace be upon her) claim on Fadak). Consequently, he would be bound to accept every argument advanced by her after making this concession.”

The fourth reason was that right, if not given, should always be demanded. So, the one whose right is usurped is bound to claim his right and struggle for it, since the right is his whether he needs it or is attached to it. The right to claim a usurped property is not related to one’s piety or indifference to the world. One can be pious and aloof from worldly possessions and still claim his usurped right vociferously.

The fifth reason is that a man, however aloof he may have remained from worldly possessions, is duty-bound to spend money on religious obligations (like joining relations – Sila-e-Rahm) and other duties enjoined by Allah the Almighty. Finance is required to perform these obligations and duties, and if that money is usurped by someone, he must attempt to recover the same to perform his religious duties. Does history not confirm that the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) was the most pious and God-fearing of all Muslims? Even then, to further the cause of Islam, he needed the property and wealth of Hazrat Khadijah (peace be upon her).

The sixth reason is that reason demands that one should struggle to assert his usurped right. This can give rise to one of two scenarios:

a) If his struggle bears fruit, he will get what he wanted. Thus, his objective would be achieved in his struggle.

b) If he fails in his endeavor and cannot reclaim his right, the usurper would stand fully exposed before all those who are aware of the truth. Every time people see the oppressed man, they will be reminded of the usurper regardless of his good qualities and ethics. In fact, the people will come to realize that these qualities are a façade under which the usurper oppresses and cheats people.

The seventh reason was to invite the attention of the masses toward their oppressed state. Imposters and frauds use money and influence to win the heart of the masses. But the noblemen win over the masses with their sincerity and ethics. When oppressed, such people use wisdom and exhortation to prove their point so that the people can clearly differentiate between the oppressor and the oppressed one and support the latter in his struggle against the former.

Thus, keeping in view the abovementioned factors, there was merit in Hazrat Fatemah Zahra’s (peace be upon her) crusade against the government that made her address the Muslims in Masjid al-Nabavi, the Mosque of her beloved father (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) in a bid to establish her right.

She (peace be upon her) did not go to the house of the first caliph for discussions. Instead, she selected a place that was the center for discussion and the meeting point for Muslims. She (peace be upon her) also selected the best time to go to the mosque. At that time, the mosque was filled to capacity by the Muhajireen, the Ansaar, and people of various social strata. Moreover, she did not go to the mosque alone; rather she was accompanied by a group of ladies, who surrounded her.

Before her arrival in the mosque, a curtain was suspended at a pre-determined place so that she might address the audience from behind it

These arrangements were made so that she could present her arguments without compromising on etiquette. After all, she was the daughter of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) who had proclaimed, “I am the most learned and cultured man in the whole of Arabia.” She was a role model for all Muslim women till the Day of Judgment as her father (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) had declared, “An angel informed me and gave me glad tidings that my daughter, Fatemah is the chief of all women of my nation.”

title.rendered: If Dissimulation (Taqiyyah) is our religion, then shouldn’t it be practiced always?

content.rendered:
Certainly, dissimulation (Tayiqqah) is our religion but it is important to know where to practice Taqiyyah. His Eminence Imam Sadiq (peace be upon him) says:

إِنَّمَا جُعِلَتِ التَّقِيَّةُ لِيُحْقَنَ بِهَا الدَّمُ فَإِذَا بَلَغَتِ التَّقِيَّةُ الدَّمَ فَلَا تَقِيَّةَ

“Certainly, dissimulation (Taqiyyah) has been kept so that blood is protected but if despite dissimulation (Taqiyyah) blood is split (life cannot be protected), then there is no (need for) dissimulation (Taqiyyah).”

وَ ايْمُ اللهِ لَوْ دُعِيْتُمْ لِتَنْصُرُوْنَا لَقُلْتُمْ لَا نَفْعَلُ إِنَّمَا نَتَّقِي وَ لَكَانَتِ التَّقِيَّةُ أَحَبَّ إِلَيْكُمْ مِنْ آبَائِكُمْ وَ أُمَّهَاتِكُمْ

“By Allah! If we call you for helping us, you will say ‘we will not do so because we are practicing dissimulation (Taqiyyah) and this dissimulation (Taqiyyah) is dearer to you than your fathers and mothers…”

[Tahzeeb al-Ahkaam, vol. 6, p. 172, H. 335]

Imam Ali Ibn Moosa al-Reza (peace be upon him) refused to meet some people who had claimed to be Shias by saying:

لِدَعْوَاكُمْ أَنَّكُمْ شِيْعَةُ أَمِيْرِ الْمُؤْمِنِيْنَ … وَ أَنْتُمْ فِي أَكْثَرِ أَعْمَالِكُمْ لَهُ مُخَالِفُوْنَ وَ تُقَصِّرُوْنَ فِي كَثِيْرٍ مِنَ الْفَرَائِضِ وَ تَتَهَاوَنُوْنَ بِعَظِيْمِ حُقُوْقِ إِخْوَانِكُمْ فِي اللهِ وَ تَتَّقُوْنَ حَيْثُ لَا تَجِبُ التَّقِيَّةُ وَ تَتْرُكُوْنَ التَّقِيَّةَ حَيْثُ لَا بُدَّ مِنَ التَّقِيَّةِ

“As for your claim that you are the Shias of Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) … you defy him in most of your actions, fall short in many of your obligations, belittle the greatest rights of your brothers in faith, you practice dissimulation (Taqiyyah) where there is no obligation it and forsake it where it is necessary to practice it.”

[Tafseer Imam Hasan Askari (a.s.), p. 313, H. 159; Al-Ehtejaaj, vol. 2, p. 441]

Hence, according to these traditions, dissimulation (Taqiyyah) is not permissible when it comes to supporting Ahlul Bait (a.s.) and defending their rights.

title.rendered: Shias are killed due to Tabarra!

content.rendered:
Did the companions of our infallible Imams (a.s.) like Meesam al-Tammar, Ammar Yasir, Malik al-Ashtar, Hujr Ibn Adi, martyrs of Karbala, other companions, scholars, and all those who laid their lives in defense of the Mastership (Wilaayah) of Ahlul Bait (peace be upon them) express dissociation (Tabarra) or no?

Of course, they did since they were mindful of the fact that the Mastership of the Ahlul Bait (peace be upon them) is incomplete without dissociating from their enemies. For them, the divine religion, especially the Wilaayah of Ahlul Bait (peace be upon them) was more valuable than their own lives.

When a person complained to Imam Ali Ibn Moosa al-Reza (peace be upon him), “You are speaking all this while blood (of Shias) is still dripping from the swords (of enemies).” Imam Reza (peace be upon him) replied to him:

إِنَّ لِلّٰهِ وَادِياً مِنْ ذَهَبٍ حَمَاهُ بِأَضْعَفِ خَلْقِهِ النَّمْلِ فَلَوْ رَامَهُ الْبَخَاتِيُّ لَمْ تَصِلْ إِلَيْهِ‏

“Certainly, with Allah is a golden valley which He protects through ants who are His weakest of creations. But even if tall camels wish to enter it, they cannot reach it.”

[Al-Kaafi, vol. 2, p. 59, H. 11]

Hence, if someone attains martyrdom due to Tabarra, then it is certainly a cause of a great blessing for him.

title.rendered: Is Tabarra a Prophetic Practice (Sunnah)?

content.rendered:
We find the practice (Sunnah) of Prophet Ibrahim (a.s.) in the Holy Quran thus:

قَدْ كَانَتْ لَكُمْ أُسْوَةٌ حَسَنَةٌ فِي‏ إِبْرَاهِيْمَ وَ الَّذِيْنَ مَعَهُ إِذْ قَالُوْا لِقَوْمِهِمْ

“Indeed, for you there is an excellent example in Ibrahim (a.s.) and those with him when they said to their people”

إِنَّا بُرَآؤُا مِنْكُمْ وَ مِمَّا تَعْبُدُوْنَ مِنْ دُوْنِ اللهِ

“Surely we dissociate from you and from whatever you worship besides Allah”

كَفَرْنَا بِكُمْ

“We deny you”

وَ بَدَا بَيْنَنَا وَ بَيْنَكُمُ الْعَدَاوَةُ وَ الْبَغْضَاءُ أَبَداً حَتَّى تُؤْمِنُوْا بِاللهِ وَحْدَهُ

“And enmity and hatred have appeared between us and you forever until you believe in Allah alone.”

[Surah Mumtahenah (60): Verse 4]

This is the practice (Sunnah) of an Ulul Azm Prophet, His Eminence Ibrahim (a.s.) in which there is both, Tabarra as well as condemnation of the enemies of religion!

title.rendered: Does Cursing (La’nah) tantamount to hurting sentiments?

content.rendered:
Firstly, it should be known that calling ‘evil’ an ‘evil’ is not at all inappropriate. It is a norm across the world as well. If a person oppresses someone, then the oppressed one has all the right to call the oppressor an evil person. On the contrary, the oppressor has no right to feel hurt due to this.

When we express our Baraa’ah and curse enemies of Ahlul Bait (peace be upon them), we are actually calling out the evil of those people who oppressed the chosen ones of Allah, the High, and usurped their rights. This action of ours is, in fact, a Divine practice (Sunnah) as mentioned in the Holy Quran:

إِنَّ الَّذِيْنَ يُؤْذُوْنَ اللهَ وَ رَسُوْلَهُ لَعَنَهُمُ اللهُ فِي الدُّنْيَا وَ الْآخِرَةِ وَ أَعَدَّ لَهُمْ عَذَاباً مُهِيْناً

“Indeed those who hurt Allah and His Messenger, Allah curses them in this world and the hereafter and He has prepared for them a debasing chastisement.”

[Surah Ahzaab (33): Verse 57]

Hence, in reality, Tabarra and cursing (La’nah) is an expression of truth and should not be misinterpreted as hurting someone’s sentiments.

title.rendered: Are Baraa’ah and Tabarra not the same?

content.rendered:
Baraa’ah is heartily dissociation from anyone whereas the manifestation of this dissociation is known as ‘Tabarra’.

[Qaamoos Alfaaz al-Quran, p. 45]

For instance, belief in Tauheed (Divine Monotheism) demands that we wholeheartedly dissociate from any other deity besides Allah. The statement ‘There is no god but Allah’ (Laa Ilaaha Illallah) is the manifestation of this belief.

Similarly, Baraa’ah is a part of our belief in Imamah which has two foundations –

1. Accepting the Mastership and Caliphate of the 12 successors of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy family) after him
2. Dissociating from the opponents and enemies of these 12 Imams (peace be upon them) which is manifested by cursing them.

Like it has been mentioned in Aayat al-Kursi of the Holy Quran:

فَمَنْ يَكْفُرْ بِالطَّاغُوْتِ وَ يُؤْمِنْ بِاللهِ فَقَدِ اسْتَمْسَكَ بِالْعُرْوَةِ الْوُثْقَى‏

“Therefore the one who denies the Taaghoot (Satan) and believes in Allah has indeed held on to the strong rope.”

[Surah Baqarah (2): Verse 256]

Taaghoot (Satan) refers to those who usurped the rights of the progeny of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him and his holy family) and The Strong Rope is the Mastership of 12 Imams (peace be upon them).

[Tafseer al-Qummi, vol. 1, p. 84]

title.rendered: Azaadaari Kam Na Ho – Ayyaam e Azaa e Mohsiniyyah (a.s.) Hain!

content.rendered:
Mufazzal Ibn Umar narrates in a lengthy tradition from Imam Ja’far Sadiq (peace be upon him) regarding how Mohsin Ibn Ali (peace be upon him) will be brought on the Day of Judgement. He (peace be upon him) said:

 

“When Mohsin (peace be upon him) will be brought, he will be carried by Lady Khadija (peace be upon her) and Lady Fatima Bint Asad (peace be upon him) and they would be wailing. Then Her Eminence Fatima (peace be upon her) (on seeing her child) will exclaim,

هٰذَا يَوْمُكُمُ الَّذِي كُنْتُمْ تُوْعَدُوْنَ‏

“This is your day which you were promised.”

[Surah Anbiya (21): verse 103]

“On the day that every soul shall find present what it has done of good and what it has done of evil, it shall wish that between it and that (evil), there were a long duration of time”

[Surah Aale Imraan (3): verse 30]

Then Imam Sadiq (peace be upon him) began to weep such that his beard was soaked in tears and then he (peace be upon him) said, ‘May that eye not be soothed which does not weep at the mention of this – i.e., at the martyrdom of Mohsin (peace be upon him).’ Hearing this, Mufazzal also wept for a long time and then asked, ‘O my master! What is the reward of these tears?’ Imam (peace be upon him) replied, ‘If he is on the truth then its reward cannot be enumerated.’

[Behaar al-Anwaar, vol. 53, p. 23]

The days of mourning are passing away very swiftly. It seems as if it was yesterday that the moon of Muharram was sighted and we invited Imam Husain (peace be upon him) as a guest in our houses, mourning places, and in our eyes. The moon of Muharram announced the news of the martyrdom of the beloved of Fatima (peace be upon her). The month of Muharram passed by and the month of Safar entered in such a manner that the daughters of Fatima (peace be upon her) had to enter the markets of Kufa and Damascus. The month of Safar brought along such tragedies with itself that Imam Sajjaad (peace be upon him) wept his entire life over it. Towards the end of Safar, such calamities befell Lady Fatima (peace be upon her) that she lost her father who was a mercy for the worlds and in 50 A.H. she witnessed the pieces of the liver of Imam Hasan (peace be upon him) from her broken grave. But, on 28th Safar 11 A.H., the moment the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) was martyred, in Rabi al-Awwal the house of purification was attacked so brutally that the unborn child of Imam Ali (peace be upon him) and Her Eminence Fatima (peace be upon her) was martyred in his mother’s womb by the tyrants. It was the martyrdom of Mohsin Ibn Ali (peace be upon him) which laid the foundation of Karbala. Hence, from 28th Safar till 8th Rabi al-Awwal i.e. till the martyrdom of Imam Hasan Askari (peace be upon him), the lovers of the Ahlul Bait (peace be upon him) observe these 10 days as ‘Ayyaam-e-Azaa-e-Mohsiniyyah’ so that the world comes to know that those Ahlul Bait whose love was ordained in the Holy Quran, how the Muslim Ummah treated them by defying the Quranic orders. Hence, it is our responsibility that although these 10 days are the last 10 days of the mourning period, however, our grief, weeping, and mourning should never reduce during this time because for us these might be the last days of the mourning period but, for the Ahlul Bait (peace be upon him) this was the beginning of their tragedies.

We pray to Allah to grant us the opportunity to observe these Ayyam-e-Azaa-e-Mohsiniyyah. Who knows whether this would be our last mourning opportunity? Lastly, to avenge the killing of Mohsin (peace be upon him) and the oppressions upon the Ahlul Bait (peace be upon him), hasten the reappearance of the Imam of our time, His Eminence Imam Mahdi (may Allah hasten his noble reappearance).

Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!

title.rendered: Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) & Ziyaarat of Arbaeen

content.rendered:
The second among the four special deputies of His Eminence Imam Mahdi (may Allah hasten his noble reappearance), Muhammad Ibn Usmaan Ibn Saeed al-Amri (may Allah have mercy upon him) was asked:

“Have you seen the master of this affair viz. Imam Mahdi (may Allah hasten his noble reappearance)?”

He replied: “Yes, my last meeting with him was near the Sacred House of Allah (Holy Kaabah) while he was praying,

اللّٰهُمَّ أَنْجِزْ لِيْ مَا وَعَدْتَنِيْ

“O Allah! Fulfil for me whatever You have promised me.”

[Behaar al-Anwaar, vol. 52, p. 30, H. 23 narrating from Kamaaluddin]

It is found in another tradition that Imam Mahdi (may Allah hasten his noble reappearance) was holding on to the cloth of the Holy Kaabah while saying,

اللّٰهُمَّ انْتَقِمْ مِنْ أَعْدَائِيْ

“O Allah! Take revenge from my enemies.”

[Behaar al-Anwaar, vol. 52, p. 30, H. 23 narrating from Kamaaluddin]

We recite a similar statement in Ziyaarat of Arbaeen of Imam Husain (peace be upon him). A visitor of Imam Husain (peace be upon him) confesses to him in the Arbaeen Ziyaarat thus:

وَ أَشْهَدُ أَنَّ اللهَ مُنْجِزٌ لَكَ مَا وَعَدَكَ وَ مُهْلِكٌ مَنْ خَذَلَكَ وَ مُعَذِّبٌ مَنْ قَتَلَكَ

“And I bear witness that Allah will fulfil for you whatever He has promised you; He will destroy the one who abandoned you and punish the one who killed you.”

It means after Ziyaarat of Aashoora and Dua Nudba, it is evident that there is a special bond between Imam Mahdi (may Allah hasten his noble reappearance) and Imam Husain (peace be upon him). Imam Mahdi (may Allah hasten his noble reappearance) is not just the inheritor of Imam Husain (peace be upon him) but also the avenger of his blood. It is evident from both these traditions and this statement of the Arbaeen Ziyaarat how important it is for those who mourn the martyrdom of Imam Husain (peace be upon him) to pray for the early reappearance of Imam Mahdi (may Allah hasten his noble reappearance).

Since Imam Mahdi (may Allah hasten his noble reappearance) himself has been praying for revenge from the killers of Imam Husain (peace be upon him) and his own reappearance for the past approximately 1200 years, imagine how fervently should the lovers of Imam Husain (peace be upon him), his mourners and his visitors be praying for the early reappearance of Imam Mahdi (may Allah hasten his noble reappearance).

O Allah! For the sake of the oppression on Imam Husain (peace be upon him), hasten the reappearance of the avenger of Imam Husain (peace be upon him) and the Imam of our time, His Eminence Imam Mahdi (may Allah hasten his noble reappearance). Grant us the good fortune of praying for his reappearance in the mausoleum of Imam Husain (peace be upon him) while holding on to his shrine, and grant us the opportunity to take revenge on his enemies after his reappearance.

Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!

title.rendered: The Ehraam of Ziyaarah

content.rendered:
The great companion Muhammad Ibn Muslim (r.a.) narrates that I asked Imam Ja’far Sadiq (peace be upon him):

 

“When we set out to visit your father (viz. Imam Husain (peace be upon him)) are we in a state of Hajj?”

 

Imam (peace be upon him) replied, “Yes.”

 

I further asked, “Then does all what applies to a Hajj pilgrim apply to us as well?”

 

Imam (peace be upon him) asked, “What are you referring to?”

 

I said, “The good behaviour which is applicable to a Hajj pilgrim.”

 

Imam (peace be upon him) replied, “It is necessary for you to be a good companion to those who accompany you, speak less and say only that which is good; remember Allah often, wear clean clothes, perform Ghusl before going to the holy shrine, be humble, recite more (Mustahabb) prayers, invoke blessings on Muhammad (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) and his progeny (peace be upon them) excessively, guard your honour by not taking that which does not belong to you, lower your gaze, help your needy brothers, give solace to them and act with Taqayyah, which is from the pillars of your religion. Abstain from that which is forbidden, keep away from fighting, taking false oaths and from quarrelling which leads to taking false oaths. If you follow this, your Hajj and Umrah will be complete. And being away from your family and by your inclination to the Ziyaarat of Imam Husain (peace be upon him) you will earn forgiveness, mercy and pleasure of Allah, whose blessings you sought by spending money on your journey.”

 

[Kaamil al-Ziyaaraat, chapter 48, p. 131, H. 1]

 

It is indeed a great bounty of Allah that He has bestowed us with the Mastership (Wilaayah) of such Imams who, not just guide us to the path of salvation in the hereafter but also show us the way to reach the highest levels of good morals. But alas, people did not value such divine leaders. Rather, they oppressed them and martyred them. Now, it is our responsibility to uphold the highest morals as per the teachings of the Ahlul Bait (peace be upon them) such that the true character of the mourners of Imam Husain (peace be upon him) is manifest for all. May Allah grant us the good fortune to reform our world and hereafter in the light of the teachings of Ahlul Bait (peace be upon them).

Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!

title.rendered: Our Duties Towards Azadari

content.rendered:
Download as PDF

1. Talk to Imam Husain (peace be upon him)

Specify a time during your day or night where you converse with Imam Husain (peace be upon him). Say salaam to him. Make some covenant with him and respond to his call (labbayk).

2. Regularly pray any one of the Ziyarat of Imam Husain (peace be upon him).

Fix a time for it. You can recite the following ziyaaraat:

  1. Ziyaarat-e-Waaresah
  2. Ziyaarat-e-Aashoora

Especially in the first ten days, your recitation should be with deliberation on the meanings of the wordings of these ziyaaraat.

3. Read a book on Karbala
After consultations with some learned people, select a book or books on Karbala and read them throughout these days of mourning. This will increase your ma’refat about Imam Husain (peace be upon him) and his companions which will take you nearer to them.

4. Manifest the rituals of Azadari
So that all those around you should know that you are in a state of mourning for your Imam (peace be upon him). Wear black clothes, hoist the alam of Hazrat Abbas (peace be upon him) on your houses, put black bedsheets, curtains and wall displays in your houses and other such things by which it should be known to the world that you are in a state of mourning.

5. Talk about Karbala
During these days of mourning, especially the first ten days, try to speak as much as possible about Karbala, Imam Husain (peace be upon him), his personality, his uprising, etc. Speak about it to your families, friends, and other members of our society.

6. Participate in the Majaalis of Imam Husain (peace be upon him)
Attend and participate in at least one or two majlis every day along with your family. Of course, ideally you must attend as much as possible, but two is minimum. Don’t let Shaitan dissuade you by excuses like the zakir is not giving any matter, etc.

7. Contributions
Contribute to the mourning of Imam Husain (peace be upon him) in whatever way you can like arranging for food, establishing Sabeel, distributing water free of cost, calling different Anjumans to your house or Imambargah for Matam and Nauhas, etc. Appreciating and encouraging those who recite nauhas. Arranging zaakirs for those areas where the populace cannot afford to host one.

8. Seek nearness to Allah through Zikr-e-Husain (peace be upon him)
Zikr-e-Husain (peace be upon him) should be the cause of your nearness to Allah (s.w.t.) i.e., it should lead you to acts of obedience of Allah like prayers, fasting, reciting Holy Quran, dua, helping the poor, etc. and avoid sins as much as possible, like backbiting, lies, not wearing the hijab, etc. Using this opportunity, you must also promise to Imam Husain (peace be upon him) that you will avoid sins as much as possible.

9. Keep the company of the scholars
Keep the company of the scholars as much as possible and benefit from their knowledge and greater ma’refat about Imam Husain (peace be upon him). Ask them questions, share your thoughts with them, listen to their advice and guidance, etc. because they are the trustees of religion after the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) and the infallible Imams (peace be upon them).

10. Pray for the early reappearance of Imam-e-Zaman (a.t.f.s.)
In these days, after every action of mourning, do not forget to pray for the early reappearance of our beloved master, Hazrat Baqiyatullah al-Aazam (a.t.f.s.) for he is the real heir of Imam Husain (peace be upon him) who deserves to receive condolences and one who will take the revenge of Imam Husain (peace be upon him)’s blood, inshallah. He is the one who sheds tears of blood and wails for his ancestor, day and night.

title.rendered: The Day when Umar Ibn Khattab congratulated Imam Ali (a)

content.rendered:
Disregarding the intensity of the heat, overcoming the fatigue of the Hajj, maneuvering the queue of more than 125,000 pilgrims, a voice spontaneously echoed in the hot desert, “Congratulations, congratulations, O son of Abu Talib, today you have become my master and the master of every Muslim.” It was not long before the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) had announced “Of whomsoever, I am the master, this Ali is his master” that Umar Ibn Khattab congratulated Imam Ali (peace be upon him) in the plains of Ghadeer Khum with these words. All historians recorded this event. Ibn Asaakir in his book Taareekh Madinah Damishq has narrated from Abu Hurairah thus:

“Whoever fasts on the 18th of Dhu al-Hijjah, Allah will record for him the reward of 60 years of fasting because this is the occasion when the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) held the hand of Ali Ibn Abi Talib (peace be upon them both) and asked the people on the day of Ghadeer Khum,

أَلَسْتُ مَوْلَى الْمُؤْمِنِينَ

‘Am I not the master of the believers?’

People replied: “Yes, O Messenger of Allah!” Then the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) took the hand of Ali Ibn Abi Talib (peace be upon them both) and announced:

مَنْ کُنْتُ مَوْلَاہُ فَعَلِیٌّ مَوْلَاہُ

“Of whomsoever, I am the master, then Ali is his master.”

Immediately after this announcement, Umar Ibn Khattab went ahead and congratulated Imam Ali (peace be upon him) and said,

بَخٍّ بَخٍّ یَا بْنَ اَبِیْ طَالِبٍ، اَصْبَحْتَ مَوْلَایَ وَ مَوْلَی کُلِّ مُسْلِمٍ

“Congratulations, congratulations, O son of Abu Talib, today you have become my master and the master of every Muslim.”

[Taareekh Madinah Damishq, vol. 42, p. 234]

It is evident from this narration that neither this day is an ordinary day, this announcement and action of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) was any ordinary announcement and action, nor was the greeting of Umar Ibn Khattab an ordinary greeting that it should be neglected and the most important page in Islamic history be ignored. Eid al-Ghadeer is not an ordinary day that just passes away and Muslims remain unaware of the significance of this day. Eid al-Ghadeer is that great occasion which was narrated by great companions like Abu Saeed Khudri that on 18th Dhu al-Hijjah, 10 AH, on the occasion of Hajjah al-Wida viz. the last Hajj of Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny), in which the following verse was revealed at Ghadeer Khum:

يَا أَيُّهَا الرَّسُوْلُ بَلِّغْ مَا أُنْزِلَ إِلَيْكَ مِنْ رَبِّكَ وَ إِنْ لَمْ تَفْعَلْ فَمَا بَلَّغْتَ رِسَالَتَهٗ وَ اللهُ يَعْصِمُكَ مِنَ النَّاسِ إِنَّ اللهَ لَا يَهْدِي الْقَوْمَ الْكَافِرِيْنَ

“O, Messenger! Deliver what has been revealed unto you from your Lord, and if you do not do it, it is as if you did not deliver His message (at all), and Allah will protect you from the people for surely Allah does not guide the disbelievers.”

[Surah Maaedah (5): Verse 67]

[Tafseer al-Durr al-Manthoor by Jalaaluddin Suyuti, vol. 3, p. 117; Fath al-Qadeer by Imam Shaukaani, vol. 3, p. 86; Asbaab al-Nuzool by Ali Ibn Ahmed Waahedi, vol. 1, p. 204, H. 403]

Suyuti and Imam Shaukaani have also narrated on the authority of Abdullah Ibn Masood that during the time of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) we used to recite this verse as follows:

يَا أَيُّهَا الرَّسُوْلُ بَلِّغْ مَا أُنْزِلَ إِلَيْكَ مِنْ رَبِّكَ – اَنَّ عَلِیًّامَوْلَی الْمُوْمِنِیْنَ – وَ إِنْ لَمْ تَفْعَلْ فَمَا بَلَّغْتَ رِسَالَتَهٗ

“O, Messenger! Deliver what has been revealed unto you from your Lord, – that surely Ali is the Master of the believers – and if you do not do it, it is as if you did not deliver His message (at all)”

After the revelation of this verse, the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) announced the succession of Ameerul Momineen Imam Ali (peace be upon him). In Sunan Tirmidhi, Hadith 3713, it is mentioned that this tradition of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) in which he said, ‘Of Whomsoever I am the master, this Ali is his master’ is correct (Sahih). Therefore, none can deny the authenticity of Eid al-Ghadeer. But instead of accepting this hadith and this incident, and instead of following the practice (Sunnah) of Umar Ibn Khattab, the skeptics put forward all sorts of frivolous objections to hide this clear incident from the people and deprived them of its importance. One of their unwarranted objections is that in this tradition, the word ‘Maula’ means ‘friend’ and not a master, a guardian, and one who has authority over people’s lives and property like the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny). They should keep in mind that:

  • This announcement was made by the Prophet of Islam (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) during his last Hajj and hence it has its own individual status and importance
  • This announcement was done amidst 125,000 Hajj pilgrims and was witnessed by great companions
  • If the word ‘Maula’ means friend, then was it the practice (Sunnah) of the companions that everyone should be congratulated in a gathering for friendship?
  • God forbid, was Imam Ali (peace be upon him) an enemy to anyone prior to this that his friendship was being declared?
  • If anyone, due to prejudice or ignorance, believes that the word ‘Maula’ means friend, then was it the practice (Sunnah) of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) that the friendship of every companion should be announced in a congregation? If it was, why is there no historical record of such an announcement for the rest of the companions? And if it wasn’t, then there is nothing wrong with removing the veils of negligence and accepting that this announcement was a special one.

We shouldn’t find ourselves in a situation where we become deserving of the punishment for deliberately concealing the event of Ghadeer, as history is witness that the consequences of deliberately hiding this event have been dangerous.

Amirah Ibn Sa’d narrates that “I saw Imam Ali (peace be upon him) ascending the pulpit and the companions of the Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny), including Abu Sa’eed, Abu Hurairah, Anas bin Malik, and 12 such people gathered around the pulpit. At that time Imam Ali (peace be upon him) asked all of them, ‘I implore you in the name of Allah, did you not hear the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) say: Of whomsoever, I am the master, this Ali is his master?’ They said, ‘By Allah, Yes!’ But one companion remained seated and did not bear this witness. Imam Ali (peace be upon him) asked him, ‘What has prevented you from giving this testimony?’ He replied, ‘I have become old and I do not remember’. Upon hearing this, Imam Ali (peace be upon him) complained to Allah thus, ‘O Allah! If he is telling a lie, then send down upon him a calamity that destroys his beauty!’ A white spot had appeared on his forehead which he was unable to hide even with a turban and it remained there until his death.”

[Hilyah al-Awliyaa by Hafiz Abu Nu’aim Isfahani, vol. 5, pp. 26-27]

Eid al-Ghadeer is an important Islamic Eid. Why should Muslims stay behind in celebrating a day whose importance can be understood from the fact that the Almighty Allah revealed a verse, His Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) announces it and a companion like Umar Ibn Khattab offers congratulations. Will Muslims also ignore the practice (Sunnah) of companions?

Therefore, let’s celebrate Eid al-Ghadeer by following the command of God, the command of His Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny), and the practice (Sunnah) of the companions. Let’s make elaborate arrangements to celebrate it and let all our family members, relatives, friends, and friends know the importance of this greatest Eid!

Lastly, we congratulate the ‘Maula’ (master) of our time, Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) on this joyous occasion and pray to Allah to hasten his blessed reappearance. May Allah grant us the opportunity and good fortune to celebrate this Eid al-Ghadeer alongside him in Najaf. Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!

title.rendered: Promise of Imam Reza (a.s.) to his Pilgrims

content.rendered:
A believer always strives to achieve proximity to Allah the Almighty through the medium of sincere and heartily inclination to each of the holy infallibles (peace be upon them) and provide the means through the visitations of the holy infallibles (peace be upon them) to achieve quick fulfilment of his supplications and desires. The best way to please Allah, the Almighty, and gain true proximity to Him, is to visit the holy shrines of Ahlul Bayt (peace be upon them). From among these is the grand mausoleum of 8th divine proof, the Imam who guarantees, Abul Hasan al-Thaani and the third Ali from the 12 Imams (peace be upon him), His Eminence Imam Ali Ibn Moosa al-Reza (peace be upon him). Due to his blessed footsteps and sanctified shrine, the city of Mashhad is known as Mashhad al-Muqaddas (Sacred).

The visitation (Ziyaarah) of Imam Reza (peace be upon him) is not just a pilgrimage but it is a promise of Imam Reza (peace be upon him) himself that he has made to each of his visitors. The Imam (peace be upon him) said:

“Whoever visits me in the land which is far away from my homeland, I will myself come to visit him on the Day of Resurrection at three places, such that I will grant him salvation from the fear of those places. First, when people will be given their scroll of deeds in their right and left hands. Second, the bridge (Seraat), and third, when the deeds will be weighed on the Scale (Mizaan).”

[Uyoon-o-Akhbaar al-Reza (a.s.), vol. 2, p. 255, H. 2]

Note:

  • All these three places are where every person will be extremely fearful and if he fails at any of these stations, then his abode will be hell
  • If a person’s deeds are given in his left hand instead of his right hand, he is destined for Hell
  • If his feet slip on the bridge (Seraat), he will straightaway go into the Hell-fire
  • If, on the Scale (Mizaan), his bad deeds outweigh his good deeds, then too, his abode will be hell

This means that the pilgrimage (Ziyaarah) of Imam Reza (peace be upon him) will benefit the people where they need it the most. But this honor is only for the one who believes in the leadership (Imamate) of Imam Reza (peace be upon him) and visits him considering him as the true Imam. Imam Reza (peace be upon him) himself has pointed out this fact. He (peace be upon him) said:

“Whoever, from among my lovers, visits me cognizant of my right, then on the Day of Judgment, I and my forefathers will intercede for him.”

[Uyoon-o-Akhbaar al-Reza (a.s.), vol. 2, p. 257, H. 11]

We pray to Allah the Almighty that He hastens the reappearance of the heir of Imam Reza (peace be upon him), and the Imam of our time, His Eminence Imam al-Mahdi (a.t.f.s.), so that along with him, we can reconstruct Jannat al-Baqi, as beautiful as the shrine of Imam Reza (peace be upon him) and grant those who accept the Mastership of Imam Reza (peace be upon him), the opportunity to visit Imam Reza (peace be upon him) while being fully cognizant of his rights.

Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!
