title.rendered: The Real Reason behind the destruction of Jannat al-Baqi

content.rendered:
The hatred, malice, and enmity towards the Ahlul Bait (peace be upon them) is such an incurable illness, due to which a person loses his intellect in this world and Paradise in the Hereafter and the only reason for this is ‘jealousy’. But those who are jealous completely ignore the fact that the position and status that the Ahlul Bait (peace be upon them) possess, is endowed to them by Allah.

Allah, the High says in the Holy Quran:

أَمْ يَحْسُدُونَ النَّاسَ عَلى‏ ما آتاهُمُ اللهُ مِنْ فَضْلِهِ فَقَدْ آتَيْنا آلَ إِبْراهيمَ الْكِتابَ وَ الْحِكْمَةَ وَ آتَيْناهُمْ مُلْكاً عَظيمًا

“Why do people feel jealous about what Allah has given them from His Grace? Surely We gave the progeny of Ibrahim the Book and wisdom and have given them a great kingdom.”

[Surah Nisaa (4): 54]

Since all these merits and excellences are granted by Allah, the High, those who could not snatch these merits and positions from the progeny of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him and his holy progeny), resorted to the path of oppression. Sometimes, by means of usurping their rights, breaking the allegiance paid to them, going to war against them, martyring them by poison or sword, and sometimes by killing their followers and lovers. They went to such extremes that when they found that despite all their efforts, the position, honour, and respect of the progeny of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) was intact, they began to take revenge on their holy graves.

The destruction of the Holy Cemetery of Jannat al-Baqi is a result of this very jealousy for the progeny of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon them) which is found in the hearts of extremists and people with a terroristic mindset. No Muslim can ever imagine that the kingdom of Saudi Arabia, which is supposed to be the custodian of two noble sanctuaries (Makkah & Madinah) for all the Muslims, bears such malice and hatred towards the progeny of the Messenger (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) that they would demolish their graves and the domes over them.

Jannat al-Baqi is no ordinary cemetery. Who all are buried here?

1) Imam Hasan al-Mujtaba (peace be upon him)
▪️ Grandson of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him and his holy progeny)
▪️ Son of Imam Ali & Hazrat Fatima Zahra (peace be upon her)
▪️ Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) had said that Imam Hasan (peace be upon him) is one of the two leaders of the youth of Paradise

2) Imam Ali Ibn Husain Zain al-Aabideen (peace be upon him)
▪️ Son of Imam Husain (peace be upon him)
▪️ Grandson of Imam Ali Ibn Abi Talib (peace be upon him)
▪️ Great grandson of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him and his holy progeny)

3) Imam Muhammad Ibn Ali al-Baqir (peace be upon him)
▪️ Son of Imam Ali Ibn al-Husain Zain al-Aabideen (peace be upon him)
▪️ Grandson of Imam Husain (peace be upon him)
▪️ Great Grandson of Imam Ali Ibn Abi Talib (peace be upon him)
▪️ Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) had conveyed Salaam to him through the great companion Jabir Ibn Abdullah Ansari

4) Imam Ja’far Ibn Muhammad al-Sadiq (peace be upon him)
▪️ Son of Imam Muhammad Ibn Ali al-Baqir (peace be upon him)
▪️ Grandson of Imam Imam Ali Ibn al-Husain Zain al-Aabideen (peace be upon him)
▪️ Great Grandson of Imam Husain Ibn Ali (peace be upon him)
▪️ He was the teacher of the leaders of all the four Ahle Tasannun schools of thought

5) Her Eminence Fatima Zahra (peace be upon her)
▪️ Daughter of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him and his holy progeny)
▪️ Wife of Imam Ali Ibn Abi Talib (peace be upon him)
▪️ Mother of Imam Hasan, Imam Husain, Hazrat Zainab, Hazrat Umm Kulthum & Mohsin Ibn Ali (peace be upon him)
▪️ Although her exact grave is unknown but one of the possibilities mentioned in books of history is in Baqi

6) Lady Fatima Bint Asad (peace be upon her)
▪️ Mother of Imam Ali (peace be upon him)
▪️ Paternal aunt of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him and his holy progeny)
▪️ The Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) prayed for her and descended into her grave in Baqi (Mustadrak Alaa al-Sahihain, vol. 4, p. 70)

7) Aqeel Ibn Abi Talib (peace be upon him)
▪️ Son of Abu Talib and Fatima Bint Asad (peace be upon them)
▪️ Brother of Imam Ali (peace be upon him)
▪️ Father of Muslim Ibn Aqeel (peace be upon him) who was martyred in Kufa

8) Lady Fatima al-Kilaabiyyah (peace be upon her)
▪️ Also known as Umm al-Baneen
▪️ Wife of Imam Ali Ibn Abi Talib (peace be upon him)
▪️ Mother of Abbas Ibn Ali (peace be upon him)

9) Lady Safiyah Bint Abd al-Muttalib
▪️ Aunt of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him and his holy progeny)

10) Abbas Ibn Abd al-Muttalib
▪️ Uncle of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him and his holy progeny)

11) Abdullah Ibn Jafar Ibn Abi Talib
▪️ Son in law Imam Ali (peace be upon him)
▪️ Husband of Zainab Bint Ali (peace be upon her)

12) Uthman Ibn Maz’oon
▪️ Famous companion of Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) himself buried there
▪️ He was the first among the Muhaajireen to die in Madinah [Wafaa al-Wafaa by Samhoodi, vol. 3, p. 892]
▪️ He was the 14th person to accept Islam
▪️ He participated in the Battle of Badr
▪️ Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) himself buried him in Baqi [Al-Tabaqaat al-Kubra by Ibn Sa’ad, vol. 3, p. 3963]

13) Ibrahim (a.s.) the son of Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny)
▪️He is buried next to the grave of Usmaan Ibn Maz’oon [Al-Isaabah by Ibn Hajar, vol. 4, p. 461]

14) Asad Ibn Zorarah
▪️ First person among the Ansaar to be buried in Baqi
▪️ He was present in all three Bay’ah al-Uqbah
▪️ He was the first person from the people of Madinah to pay allegiance to the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny)
▪️ He established the Friday prayers in Madinah before the migration of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) [Al-Isaabah by Ibn Hajar, vol. 4, p. 461]
▪️ Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) participated in his funeral and recited his funeral prayers also [Al-Tabaqaat al-Kubra by Ibn Sa’ad, vol. 3, p. 411]

Besides this, as far as the merits of Jannat al-Baqi are concerned, the following tradition from the famous Ahle Tasannun book Sahih Muslim is sufficient in which Ayesha Bint Abi Bakr narrates that the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) used to visit Jannat al-Baqi in the last part of the night and used to say:

السَّلاَمُ عَلَيْكُمْ دَارَ قَوْمٍ مُؤْمِنِينَ وَأَتَاكُمْ مَا تُوعَدُونَ غَدًا مُؤَجَّلُونَ وَإِنَّا إِنْ شَاءَ اللهُ بِكُمْ لاَحِقُونَ اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لأَهْلِ بَقِيعِ الْغَرْقَدِ

“Peace be upon you, O the abode of believers. What you had been promised has come to you. Your time has come and soon we shall also meet you, God willing. O Allah! Forgive the people (buried) in the land of Baqi.”

[Sahih Muslim, Book 11, Hadith 131]

The tyrannical kingdom of Saudi Arabia completely ignored this fact and demolished the cemetery where the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.a.) used to send salutations upon it and sought forgiveness for the believers buried in it. They destroyed the graves of the family of the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.a.) and demolished the shrines upon the graves. In order to justify this shameful act, the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia used a lame excuse that visiting graves is an innovation (Bid’ah). But the hatred towards the Ahlul Bait (a.s.) led them astray to such an extent that they not only ignored the words of the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.a.) but also forgot the clear verses of the Holy Quran in which there is the permissibility of building a mosque over the resting place of the people of the cave

فَقَالُوا ابْنُوا عَلَيْهِم بُنْيَانًا رَّبُّهُمْ أَعْلَمُ بِهِمْ ۚ قَالَ الَّذِينَ غَلَبُوا عَلَىٰ أَمْرِهِمْ لَنَتَّخِذَنَّ عَلَيْهِم مَّسْجِدًا

“Erect an edifice over them – their Lord best knows them. Those who prevailed in their affair said: We will certainly raise a masjid over them.”

[Surah Kahf (18): Verse 21]

and taking the place (Maqaam) of Ibrahim (a.s.) as a place of prayer

وَاتَّخِذُوا مِن مَّقَامِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ مُصَلًّى

“Appoint for yourselves a place of prayer on the standing-place of Ibrahim.”

[Surah Baqarah (2): Verse 125].

During the circumambulation of the Holy Kaaba, they did not find anything wrong in praying at Hijr Ismail, which is a burial place of many Prophets (a.s.), but they had a problem only with the Ahlul Bait (a.s.) and their graves.

O Allah! For the sake of the ruins of Jannat al-Baqi, hasten the reappearance of the Imam of our time, His Eminence Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) to return the glory of this place, to seek revenge from those who demolished it and grant us the opportunity to assist him in rebuilding Jannat al-Baqi.

Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!

title.rendered: Most Important Supplication at the time of Iftaar

content.rendered:
There are many traditions narrated by the Ahlul Bait (peace be upon them) concerning supplicating at the time of breaking the fast (Iftaar) in the blessed month of Ramadan.

His Eminence Imam Hasan al-Mujtaba (peace be upon him) says:

أَنَّ لِكُلِّ الصَّائِمِ عِنْدَ فُطُورِهِ‏ دَعْوَةً مُسْتَجَابَةً

“For every fasting person there is an accepted (guaranteed) supplication at the time of breaking the fast.”

[Iqbaal al-A’maal, vol. 1, p. 116]

Therefore, in the light of the teachings of the Ahlul Bait (peace be upon them), among the various supplications that we recite while breaking the fast, there are two famous supplications in which, after fasting the whole day, enduring difficulties, hunger, and thirst, when a believing servant says:

يَا وَاسِعَ الْمَغْفِرَةِ اغْفِرْ لِي‏

“O the One whose pardon is vast, forgive me.”

all his sins are forgiven.

[Behaar al-Anwaar, vol. 95, p. 14]

And His Eminence Imam Kazim (peace be upon him) says that a fasting person must recite the following supplication at the time of breaking the fast:

اللَّهُمَّ لَكَ‏ صُمْتُ‏ وَ عَلَى رِزْقِكَ أَفْطَرْتُ‏‏‏ وَ عَلَيْكَ تَوَكَّلْتُ‏

“O, Allah! I fasted only for You, I’m breaking my fast only with the sustenance given by You and I rely solely upon You.”

[Iqbaal al-A’maal, vol. 1, p. 117]

But have we ever pondered that the divine sustenance which reaches us with the help of which we break our fast and enjoy various types of foods, reaches us through whom?

In Surah Taubah (9): Verse 59 of the Holy Quran, Allah says

وَ لَوْ أَنَّهُمْ رَضُوا ما آتاهُمُ اللَّهُ وَ رَسُولُهُ وَ قالُوا حَسْبُنَا اللَّهُ سَيُؤْتِينَا اللَّهُ مِنْ فَضْلِهِ وَ رَسُولُهُ‏

“And when they are pleased with what Allah and His Messenger have given them, they say, Allah is sufficient for us and soon Allah and His Messenger will bestow more upon them through their Grace.”

Therefore, whenever Imam Sadiq (peace be upon him) would eat anything, he would raise his hands and say,

الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ اللَّهُمَّ هَذَا مِنْكَ وَ مِنْ‏ رَسُولِكَ‏

“O Allah! This is only from You and from your Messenger (s.a.w.a.).”

[Kanz al-Fawaaed, vol. 2, p. 36]

And it is our belief that after Allah and His Messenger (peace be upon him and his holy progeny), the Imam of every era and the rightful successor of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) is the person who is the medium of the bestowal of Divine Grace. Our Master, Imam, Guardian, Benefactor, and Master of Bounties has a right upon us, and it is our duty that when we are about to eat our first morsel while breaking our fast, we must thank him first and pray for his early reappearance and then pray for ourselves. Therefore, upon sitting to eat, we must say the following,

الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ اللَّهُمَّ هَذَا مِنْكَ وَ مِنْ‏ رَسُولِكَ وَ مِنْ‏ حُجَّتِكَ ‏ اَللّٰھُمَّ عَجِّلْ لِوَلِیِّکَ الْفَرَجَ

“O Allah, this is only from You and from your Messenger and from your Proof (Hujjah). O, Allah! Hasten the reappearance of the Imam of our time.”

O Allah, please destine the reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) in this blessed month of Ramadan and grant us the good fortune to pray for his early reappearance at the time of breaking our fast.

Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!

title.rendered: Are we fulfilling Almighty Allah’s Covenant?

content.rendered:
His Eminence Abu Abdillah Imam Ja’far Sadiq (peace be upon him) said:

الْقُرْآنُ عَهْدُ اللهِ إِلَى خَلْقِهِ فَقَدْ يَنْبَغِي لِلْمَرْءِ الْمُسْلِمِ أَنْ يَنْظُرَ فِي عَهْدِهِ وَ أَنْ يَقْرَأَ مِنْهُ فِي كُلِّ يَوْمٍ خَمْسِينَ آيَة

“The Holy Quran is Allah’s covenant unto His creation. So, it is appropriate for a Muslim man to look at his covenant and read from it 50 verses daily.”

[Al-Kaafi, vol. 2, p. 9, H. 2]

Note:

  • The Holy Quran is regarded as a covenant and pledge to the Allah, the Exalted
  • In other words, this is a promise which Allah has taken from every Muslim
  • Anyone who considers himself to be a Muslim but does not recite at least 50 Quranic verses in a day has, in reality, not fulfilled his promise made to Allah, the High

May Allah, Mighty, and Majestic be He, through the medium of this very covenant i.e. the Holy Quran, grant us the opportunity to fulfil this pledge and hasten the reappearance of the true exponent of the Holy Quran, His Eminence, the Master of time viz. Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.).

Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!

So, it is appropriate for a Muslim man to look at his…

title.rendered: Question of Holy Prophet (s) to his Ummah on the Day of Judgement

content.rendered:
His Eminence Imam Muhammad Baqir (peace be upon him) narrates that Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) said:

“I shall be the first to arrive on the Day of Judgement in front of the Majestic and Powerful (Lord) and after me His Book and my progeny. Then my nation (Ummah) shall arrive and I will question them,

مَا فَعَلْتُمْ بِكِتَابِ اللهِ وَ بِأَهْلِ بَيْتِي‏

‘What did you do to the Book of Allah and my progeny?’

[Al-Kaafi, vol. 2, p. 600, H. 4]

O, Allah! Grant us the opportunity to hold fast unto the Holy Quran and Ahlul Bait (peace be upon them) so that on the Day of Judgement we do not feel embarrassed in front of Your Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny).

Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!

Then my nation (Ummah) shall…

title.rendered: The Help of Holy Quran on the Day of Judgement

content.rendered:
Jabir Ibn Yazid Jo’fi narrates that Abu Ja’far Imam Muhammad Baqir (peace be upon him) said:

“On the Day of Judgment, the Holy Quran will come in the best shape and form. He will pass by the Muslims who will say, ‘This man is from us.’ He will go toward the Prophets (peace be upon them) who will say that ‘he is one of us.’

Then he will pass toward the proximate angels who will say that he is one of us until he is before the Lord of Majesty, Mighty and Majestic be He, and will say, ‘O Lord, so and so son of so and so suffered from thirst, spent the night in vigil in the world for (reciting) me so and so son of so and so did not suffer thirst and did not spend his night in vigil (for my recitation).’

Allah, Blessed and High be He, will say, ‘Admit them in paradise.’ He will stand up and they will also rise and follow him. The believing people will be told, ‘Read and climb.’

Then Imam (peace be upon him) said that the believers will read and climb until they will reach their positions that is for them and occupy their places.’”

[Al-Kaafi, vol. 2, p. 601, H. 11]

One thing which is evident from this tradition is that the more a person recites the Holy Quran, the higher will be his grades in Paradise. Apart from this, just like we saw in this tradition that the Holy Quran will intercede on our behalf near Allah if we are vigilant about reciting it in this world.

It means that the one who is with the Holy Quran in this world, the Holy Quran will keep him with it on the Day of Judgement until it settles him in his grades in Paradise.

We pray to Allah to grant us the opportunity to increase our recitation of the Holy Quran and hasten the reappearance of the inheritor of the Holy Quran, His Eminence Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.).

Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!

title.rendered: Three Books of Records for every person on the Day of Judgement

content.rendered:
Yunus Ibn Ammar narrates that Abu Abdillah Imam Jafar Sadiq (peace be upon him) said:

“On the Day of Judgment, there will be three books of records:

  • the book of the record of the bounties,
  • the book of the record of the good deeds and
  • the book of the record of the evil deeds.

The records of the good deeds and the bounties will be compared and the record of the bounties will overwhelm all the good deeds and the record of the evil deeds will remain. Then a believer from the children of Adam (a.s.) will be called for his accounting.

At that time, the Holy Quran will come forward in the best form and say,

‘O, Lord! This believing servant would tire himself in reciting me and spend long hours during the night reading from me. During his Tahajjud (night prayer) his eyes would flood with tears. O, Lord! Make him happy just as he made me happy.’

Then Imam (peace be upon him) said that the Almighty, the Supreme (God), will say,

‘My servant! Open your right hand. Then He will fill it up with the contentment of Allah, the Most Majestic, the Almighty, and his left hand with the favor of Allah, and then it will be said to him, ‘This is Paradise and it is permissible for you. Read (from the Holy Quran) and climb up.’

Upon reading every (Quranic) Verse he will climb one degree (in Paradise).’”

[Al-Kaafi, vol. 2, p. 602, H. 12]

It means that one thing is certain from this tradition – the grades in Paradise are equivalent to the number of Quranic Verses. Hence, the one who memorized more Verses will ascend those many grades in Paradise.

We pray to Allah, the Almighty, to grant us the opportunity to memorize Quranic Verses excessively and hasten the reappearance of the Speaking Quran viz. His Eminence Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) so that he places his affectionate hand over our head such that we acquire the recognition of the Holy Quran.

Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!

title.rendered: Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) & Intercession on the Day of Judgement

content.rendered:
The 7th and 8th century Ahle Tasannun scholar and traditionalist Ibrahim Hamveeni in his book Faraaed al-Simtain, vol. 2, p. 321 has brought a chapter which is about the tradition of Ameerul Momineen Imam Ali Ibn Abi Talib (a.s.) which has a mention of the 12 Imams of whom, Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) will be the 12th Imam. In Hadith 572 of this chapter, he narrates from Maqtal al-Khwaarizmi that Imam Ali (peace be upon him) narrates from the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) who prophesied:

“I will meet all of you at the Pond of Kausar where

  • you, O Ali, will be the quencher at Kausar.
  • Hasan will lead.
  • Husain will command.
  • Ali Ibn Husain will grant abundance.
  • Muhammad Ibn Ali will distribute.
  • Jafar Ibn Muhammad will send people forward.
  • Moosa Ibn Jafar will enumerate the friends and enemies and destroy the hypocrites.
  • Ali Ibn Moosa will be the helper of the believers.
  • Muhammad Ibn Ali will allocate positions to people in heaven.
  • Ali Ibn Muhammad will pair people with their respective Hoories and get them married.
  • Hasan Ibn Ali will be the lamp of the people of paradise through whom people will derive light.
  • And it will be Mahdi who will intercede on behalf of the people on the Day of Judgement at such a place where no one will be allowed to intercede except the one whom Allah loves and is pleased with.”

The last portion of this tradition points out to Surah Najm (53): Verse 26, in which Allah says,

وَ كَمْ مِنْ مَلَكٍ فِي السَّماواتِ لا تُغْني‏ شَفاعَتُهُمْ شَيْئاً إِلاَّ مِنْ بَعْدِ أَنْ يَأْذَنَ اللهُ لِمَنْ يَشاءُ وَ يَرْضى‏

“And how many angels are there in the heavens whose intercession does not avail at all except after Allah has given permission to whom He pleases and chooses.”

Intercession is a Quranic belief and the one who rejects this belief has rejected the apparent of the Quran.

If angels can intercede, then the Progeny of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon them) is definitely superior to angels.

It means that only the one who believes in the 12 Imams (peace be upon them) will be eligible for receiving intercession. Therefore, whoever desires intercession, must believe in the Imamate of the 12 Imams, and especially in today’s day and age, one must accept the Imamate and Mastership of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.).

May Allah hasten the reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) and keep us attached to his Imamate and Mastership till the end of our lives and bless us with his intercession in the hereafter.

Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!

title.rendered: People of the Cave & Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.)

content.rendered:
Casting doubts over the longevity of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) is a consequence of not pondering over the Holy Quran. If someone refutes the longevity of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) merely on the basis of the doubt that how can a person live for 1200 years, then our question to such people is whether they have recited the Holy Quran or not?

The incident of the People of Cave in Surah Kahf and their remaining in there till date is Allah’s reply to those who only claimed that “The Book of Allah is sufficient for us”. Along with the Holy Quran, belief in its true inheritor is needed in order to be guided.

The famous Ahle Tasannun traditionalist of the 7th century, Yusuf Ibn Yahya Shaafei writes in his book Iqd al-Durar Fi Akhbar al-Muntazar, p. 213, Hadith 224 that:

Abu Ishaq Sa’labi has mentioned concerning the exegesis of Surah Kahf that,

“The cave in which those people stayed was made their resting place and they will continue to remain therein till the end of time until the reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) does not take place. When Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) will reappear, he will greet the people of the cave and Allah will bring them back to life for (replying to) him.”

The people of the cave, upon learning about the secret of their 309-year slumber, prayed to Allah for death. Allah granted their prayer and caused them to sleep in the same place until the reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) and a mosque was also built there. The Holy Quran has itself testified this in Surah Kahf (18): Verse 21

لَنَتَّخِذَنَّ عَلَيْهِمْ مَسْجِداً

“We will certainly raise a mosque over them.”

Those people of the cave will be brought back to life only to reply to the greeting of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.).

We pray to Allah that He hastens the reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) and gives us the opportunity to greet our Imam and be among his helpers.

Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!

title.rendered: The Annihilation of Satan

content.rendered:
If we glance through history, it becomes clear that Almighty Allah has been disobeyed in every era, be it in the form of Pharaoh or Nimrud, and Satan has deviated every person, big or small. But it is the grace and nobility of Allah that in every era, He has sent His Proof, Guide, and Leader in order to protect us from the onslaught of Satan. But when we look at Surah Hijr (15): Verses 36-38, we find that Allah has given a moratorium to Satan until a specified time.

So the question arises that if Satan’s existence is for a specified time, has Allah appointed anyone to protect us from satanic whisperings until this “specified time”?

The famous Ahle Tasannun traditionalist Shaikh Sulaiman Qunduzi writes in his book Yanaabee’ al-Mawaddah, chapter 71, p. 481 that Wahab Ibn Jam’aa asked Imam Sadiq (peace be upon him) concerning Surah Hijr (15): Verses 36-38:

قالَ رَبِّ فَأَنْظِرْني‏ إِلى‏ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ (36)
قالَ فَإِنَّكَ مِنَ الْمُنْظَرينَ (37)
إِلى‏ يَوْمِ الْوَقْتِ الْمَعْلُومِ (38)

(36) “He said: My Lord! then respite me till the day when they are raised.

(37) He said: So surely you are of the respited ones.

(38) Till the day of the known time.”

“Which day is that?” Imam (a.s.) replied, “O Wahab! It is the day when Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) will reappear and after that, the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) will kill Satan.”

This tradition proves that the one who refused to prostrate before Prophet Adam (a.s.) and pledged to deviate mankind until the “known time” will be killed at the hands of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) after the reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.). This belief has been endorsed by Ahle Tasannun scholars.

We pray to Allah that He hastens the reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) and protects us from Satanic evils and deviated beliefs during this occultation.

Aameen, O Lord of the worlds.

title.rendered: Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) & Salvation from Problems

content.rendered:
The Ahle Tasannun scholar of Al-Azhar University of Egypt, Momin Ibn Hasan Shablanji has mentioned a tradition in his book Noor al-Absaar, vol. 1, p. 346 in which Abu Amaamah Baaheli narrates that the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) said in his sermon while mentioning about Dajjaal that:

“All forms of uncleanliness will be eliminated from Madinah just as rust is removed from iron and that day will be called the Day of Salvation.”

In this tradition, the day of reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) has been called the Day of Salvation because, after that day, people will attain salvation from all forms of oppression, tyranny, disbelief, polytheism, sins, transgression, corruption, indecencies and satanic bonds. Apart from salvation, this day has also been called the Day of Ease and Comforts.

We find a tradition in the book Iqd al-Durar, p. 161 that Ameerul Momineen Imam Ali Ibn Talib (peace be upon him) said:

“Allah will order archangel Jibraeel (a.s.) to call out from the mosque in Damascus, “O the nation of Muhammad (s.a.w.a.)! Your saviour has arrived. O the nation of Muhammad (s.a.w.a.)! Your helper has arrived. Salvation and success have come for you and he is Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.).”

It is food for thought, not only for the Muslims but the entire mankind, that if we desire salvation from every problem, we must unite and pray for the early reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.). We pray to Allah that He hastens the reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) so that the believers can breathe easy in this world full of oppression and violence.

Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!

title.rendered: Cloud cover over Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.)

content.rendered:
In the ocean of merits of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.), one virtue and excellence which is very evident; is his similarity to the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.a.) to such an extent that even his name and agnomen is exactly the same as that of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny).

If the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) is the Master of Shariah, then Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) is the one who will implement that Shariah in the entire world. One of these interesting merits is mentioned by the Ahle Tasanun scholar Hafiz Sulaiman Qunduzi in his book Yanaabee’ al-Mawaddah, chapter 94, p. 551 that Imam Jafar Sadiq (peace be upon him) said,

“The righteous successor is from my progeny and he is Mahdi (a.t.f.s.). His name is the same as that of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) and his agnomen is Abul Qasim, he will reappear in the last era and his mother is Narjis (peace be upon her). There will be a cloud cover over him which will shade him from the rays of the sun, follow him wherever he goes, and will call out in an eloquent tone,

هٰذَا الْمَھْدِيُّ فَاتَّبِعُوْهُ

‘This is Mahdi, obey him’.”

To summarise, just as clouds used to cover the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny), similarly, a cloud will shade Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.), travel with him, and command the people to obey him.

We pray to Allah through the medium of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) that He hastens the reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.), keeps us in his protection, and includes us among his friends and helpers.

Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!

If the…

title.rendered: Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) is Superior to Prophets (a)

content.rendered:
Perhaps it might be difficult for some people to believe or they may be surprised at the fact that whether Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) is really superior to the Prophets? He certainly is!

The 7th century Ahle Tasannun scholar and traditionalist Yusuf Ibn Yahya Shaafei in his book Iqd al-Durar, vol. 1, p. 222, tradition 241, narrates from Muhammad Ibn Sireen who was asked,

“Is Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) superior or Abu Bakr and Umar?” He replied, ‘He (Mahdi) is superior to both of them and in fact, he is equal to Prophets (peace be upon them).”

And in the next tradition on p. 150 he states,

قَدْ كَانَ يَفْضِلُ عَلٰى بَعْضِ الْأَنْبِيَاءِ

“Indeed, he (Mahdi) is (actually) superior to some of the Prophets (peace be upon them).”

Another tradition has been narrated from the same narrator Muhammad Ibn Sireen is also found in the book Al-Mu’jam al-Sagheer of Hafiz Sulaiman Tabarani, p. 150 that Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) is superior to all Prophets (peace be upon them) except the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny).

Therefore, whoever believes in the Prophethood of 124000 prophets must also believe in the Imamate and Caliphate of the 12 Imams (a.s.) and especially in this time, the Imamate and Caliphate of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.). We are surprised at the astonishment of the skeptics because it is worth noting that the true scholars of the progeny of Muhammad (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) being considered superior to the Prophets of Bani Israel does not surprise them but when the superiority of the successor of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) over the Prophets is discussed, those very people express surprise and are unable to digest it.

We pray to Allah that He hastens the reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) and keeps us attached to his Imamate and Mastership until our last breath.

Aameen, O Lords of the worlds!

title.rendered: How will the time of reappearance be conveyed?

content.rendered:
7th and 8th century Ahle Tasannun scholar and traditionalist Ibrahim Hamveeni in his book Faraaed al-Simtain, vol. 2, chapter 35, narrates a tradition that:

فَقَالَ لَهُ أُبَيٌّ وَ مَا دَلاَئِلُهُ وَ عَلاَمَاتُهُ يَا رَسُولَ اَللَّهِ قَالَ لَهُ عَلَمٌ إِذَا حَانَ وَقْتُ خُرُوجِهِ اِنْتَشَرَ ذَلِكَ اَلْعَلَمُ مِنْ نَفْسِهِ وَ أَنْطَقَهُ اَللَّهُ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى فَنَادَاهُ اَلْعَلَمُ اُخْرُجْ يَا وَلِيَّ اَللَّهِ فَاقْتُلْ أَعْدَاءَ اَللَّهِ

Imam Husain (peace be upon him) says that Ubay Ibn Kaab asked the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny), “O Messenger of Allah! What are the signs and indicators of the reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.)?”

He (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) replied, “He has a flag. When the time of the reappearance will arrive, the flag will unfurl on its own, and Allah, Mighty and Majestic be He, will make the flag speak and it will call out, “Rise, O Vicegerent of Allah and kill the enemies of Allah’.”

“Another sign is that Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) has a sheathed sword. When the time of reappearance will arrive, this sword will unsheath itself on its own. Allah will make the sword (also) speak and it will call out, “Rise, O Vicegerent of Allah and you must fight the enemies of Allah’.”

It is evident from this tradition that the information of the reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) will be given through two signs – the flag and the sword, and both will speak up with Divine permission.

Apart from this, in another famous book of the Ahle Tasannun called Yanaabee’ al-Mawaddah by Hafiz Sulaiman Ibn Ibrahim Qunduzi, chapter 71, p. 487, we find a tradition in which Imam Sadiq (a.s.) has spoken about the information of reappearance in the following words:

“Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) will hear a call informing him that the time of his rising has arrived after which he will rise. That day will be very tough for the disbelievers.”

We pray to Allah that He hastens the advent of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.), and rids the world of all disbelief and hypocrisy. May Allah include us with him in this great mission.

Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!

title.rendered: Reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.): A Precondition for Qiyaamah

content.rendered:
It is mentioned in Musnad of Ahmad Ibn Hanbal, vol. 1, p. 376 and Sunan al-Tirmidhi, vol. 4, Book 34, Chapter 52, p. 505, H. 2231 that Abdullah Ibn Masood narrates from the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.a.) who informed:

“The Day of Resurrection will not occur until a person from my Ahlul Bait whose name will be the same as my name does not rise.”

Apart from this, the Ahle Tasannun scholar Ibrahim Hamveeni in his book Faraaed al-Simtain, vol. 2, pp. 325-326, H. 575 narrates from the great companion Huzaifah al-Yamaani (a.r.) that:

One day the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) was delivering a sermon in which he was mentioning the events of the future when he (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) said,

“Even if there remains only one day for this world to end, Allah will prolong that day to such an extent that He will send a man from my progeny, whose name will be my name. Salman (a.r.) stood up and asked, “O Messenger of Allah! He will be from the progeny of which of your sons?” The Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) placed his hands on the shoulder of Imam Husain (peace be upon him) and said, ‘His progeny’”.

Every Mulsim in this world performs a good action in the hope of reaping rewards of his actions on the Day of Resurrection. But, from these two traditions, we realise that the reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) is such an enormous divine affair without which the Day of Resurrection cannot be established, even if there is just a solitary day left for the world to end. In other words, the Day of Resurrection is also awaiting the Reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.).

O Allah, hasten the reappearance of the axis of the universe, the hope of humanity, heir of Imam Husain (a.s.), His Eminence the Master of time (a.t.f.s.) and help us unite upon the belief in his Imamate and Mastership.

Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!

title.rendered: Imam Mahdi (a) – The Inheritor of Prophets (a)

content.rendered:
Ahle Tasannun scholar Ibrahim Hamveeni has mentioned in his book Faraaed al-Simtain, vol. 2, p. 335, a tradition from Imam Muhammad Baqir (peace be upon him) who narrates from his father Imam Zain al-Aabideen (a.s.) from his father Imam Husain (peace be upon him) from Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) who narrates that the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) said,

“Mahdi is from my progeny. There will be an occultation for him and perplexion in which nations will have deviated. He will reappear with the inheritance of prophets. And he will fill this earth with justice and equity just as it would have been filled with oppression and tyranny.”

It is clear from this tradition that Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) will have an occultation in which people will have deviated. In other words, it will be very difficult for people to protect their faith during occultation. Another important point that has been mentioned in this tradition is that Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) will reappear with the inheritance of Prophets (peace be upon them). Inheritance of Prophets means all those miracles through which they presented the proof of their authenticity. For example, the ring of Prophet Sulaiman (peace be upon him), the staff of Prophet Musa (peace be upon him), the casket of Bani Israel which was known as the casket of ‘Sakina’. Therefore, whoever desires to see the miracles of the past Prophets must excessively pray for the reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) since he is their rightful heir.

Lastly, we pray to Allah for the sake of all Prophets (peace be upon them) that may He reward them for all their efforts in this world and hasten the reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) so that he can fulfill the aim of the Prophets (peace be upon them).

Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!

title.rendered: Obedience to Imam Mahdi (a) is obedience to the Holy Prophet (s)

content.rendered:
Ahle Tasannun scholar and traditionalist of the 3rd and 4th century Hafiz Sulaiman Tabarani in his book Al-Mu’jam al-Sagheer, vol. 2, p. 30, tradition 725 mentions that Abu Hurairah narrates from the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) who said,

“There is no Prophet between myself and Isa Ibn Maryam but my Caliph will come after me who will kill Dajjal, invalidate the beliefs of the Christians, will implement the Jizya tax, and bring an end to war and bloodshed. Then whoever among you meets him must convey my salutations to him.”

Apart from this, Ahle Tasannun scholar Yusuf Ibn Yahya Shafeei in his book Iqd al-Durar, chapter 3, p. 107, tradition 69, narrates from the famous companion of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny), Jabir Ibn Abdullah Ansari (r.a.) that Imam Muhammad Baqir (peace be upon him) said,

“When our Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) will reappear, he will deal with the people with justice and will distribute wealth equitably. He will establish a kingdom of justice. So the one who obeys him has obeyed Allah and the one who disobeys him has disobeyed Allah.”

Therefore, from the aforementioned traditions, it becomes very clear that Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) is the successor and caliph of the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.a.). Being the caliph of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny), his orders are the orders of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) and every decision is the decision of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny). The destruction of Dajjal, the nullification of the beliefs of the Christians, implementing the Jizya tax, and the establishment of a just rule are matters which were revealed by Allah upon the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny). The responsibility of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) is to take these matters to completion. Therefore, obedience to Imam Mahdi (a.s.) is obedience to the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) which in turn is obedience to Allah.

We pray to Allah to hasten the reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) and give us the opportunity to convey the salutations of his grandfather to him.

Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!

title.rendered: Denial of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) is disbelief

content.rendered:
Various Ahle Tasannun scholars have narrated traditions on the authority of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) which discuss the reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) at the end of time. But we find that many people reject the existence and reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.).

Ahle Tasannun scholar Shaikh Ibrahim Hamveeni mentions in his book Faraaed al-Simtain, vol. 2, p. 334, tradition 585, that the famous companion of the Ahlul Bait (a.s.), Jabir Ibn Abdullah Ansari (a.r.) narrated from the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) who said,

“One who rejects the reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) has rejected all that was revealed upon Muhammad (peace be upon him and his holy progeny).”

Few points are evident from this tradition.

The Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) who taught us the rules of Prayers, Fasting, Pilgrimage, Charity and other religious aspects, also mentions in his tradition that one who rejects Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) has rejected the entire Shariah. To reject the reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) is equivalent to rejecting his existence. The reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) is one of the fundamental Islamic beliefs which is proven from Quranic verses and authentic traditions.

Therefore, anyone who rejects these beliefs is out of the realms of Islam according to the above prophetic tradition.

And it is also important that the belief in Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) must be prior to his reappearance. Believing in him after his reappearance will not yield any benefit.

Ali Ibn Rabaab narrates from Imam Jafar Sadiq (peace be upon him) concerning Surah An’aam (6): Verse 158:

هَلْ يَنْظُرُونَ إِلاَّ أَنْ تَأْتِيَهُمُ الْمَلائِكَةُ أَوْ يَأْتِيَ رَبُّكَ أَوْ يَأْتِيَ بَعْضُ آياتِ رَبِّكَ يَوْمَ يَأْتي‏ بَعْضُ آياتِ رَبِّكَ لا يَنْفَعُ نَفْساً إيمانُها لَمْ تَكُنْ آمَنَتْ مِنْ قَبْلُ أَوْ كَسَبَتْ في‏ إيمانِها خَيْراً قُلِ انْتَظِرُوا إِنَّا مُنْتَظِرُونَ

“Do they wait for the angels to come to them, or that your Lord should come, or that some of the signs of your Lord should come? On the day when some of the signs of your Lord shall come, its faith shall not profit a soul which did not believe before, or earn good through its faith. Say: Wait; we too are waiting.”

[Surah An’aam (6): Verse 158]

Imam (peace be upon him) said,

“Here, the signs refer to the Imams of the Ahlul Bait (a.s) and some of the signs refer to Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.). Hence, one who does not believe in him prior to his reappearance will not benefit by believing in him when he (a.t.f.s.) rises with a sword, even if he believed in the other Imams already.”

Therefore, if a person believes in 124000 prophets and 11 Imams but does not believe in the Imamate of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.), his belief in Prophethood and Imamate is incomplete. And it is also important that the belief in the existence of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) must be before his reappearance and not after he reappears with the Zulfiqar and destroys his enemies as believing at that time will not be of any use.

May Allah hasten the reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.), keep us steadfast in our belief in his existence and reappearance, and include us among his helpers.

Aameen, O Lord of the Worlds!

title.rendered: Doubting the existence of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.)

content.rendered:
Ahle Tasannun scholar Shaikh Sulaiman Qundoozi, in his book Yanaabee’ al-Mawaddah, chapter 71, p. 485 has narrated a tradition from Imam Ja’far Sadiq (peace be upon him) in which Mufazzal Ibn Umar enquired from Imam Ja’far Sadiq (a.s.) about Surah Shura (42): Verse 18

إِنَّ الَّذينَ يُمارُونَ فِي السَّاعَةِ لَفي‏ ضَلالٍ بَعيدٍ

“Those who dispute obstinately concerning the hour are in great error.”

Imam (peace be upon him) replied:
“The sceptics ask about when Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) was born? Who has seen him? Where is he now? When will he reappear? All of this is akin to doubting Divine Decree and Power. These are those who will be at a loss in this world and the hereafter.”

To summarise, it is absolutely clear from the Quranic verse and the tradition of Imam Sadiq (peace be upon him) that people will doubt the existence of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.).

They will not just themselves be in doubt but create doubts for others as well. According to this tradition, doubting the existence of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) is like doubting the Decree and Power of Allah.

Sending 124,000 Prophets (a.s.), making Islam the last Shariah, establishing the Day of Judgement; all of these are the Divine Decrees, which means these are Allah’s decisions and no one can interfere in His decisions. Allah has regarded these as certain.

Similarly, the entire universe has been created by Divine Power and Allah can do whatever He wants, whenever He wants. He has the power of “be and it becomes” and has power over all things. The one who doubts Allah’s Decree and Power has, in reality, cast a doubt on Allah Himself.

In the same way, the existence of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.), his reappearance, his rule are the decree and power of Allah. Therefore, anyone who has any doubts concerning Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.), has undermined Allah’s Power and such a person will be at a loss in this world and the hereafter.

Lastly, we pray to Allah that He hastens the reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) and protects us from the evil of those who are sceptical about him.

Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!

title.rendered: Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) and the Consensus of the Muslims

content.rendered:
The Ahle Tasannun scholar, Ibn Khaldoon writes in his book Muqaddamah, vol. 1, p. 514 that –

“It is famously known among the Muslims of all times that in the last era, a man from the progeny of the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.a.) will reappear, who will be the helper of religion, spread justice and equity, all Muslims will obey him, he will have absolute control over the Islamic kingdom and his name will be ‘Mahdi’.

On the same page, Ibn Khaldoon continues that the traditions concerning Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) are authentic and renowned Ahle Tasannun scholars like Tirmidhi, Abu Dawood, Bazzaar, Ibn Maajah, Hakim, Tabarani, and Abu Ya’la Musoli have narrated traditions on the authority of companions viz. Imam Ali (a.s.), Ibn Abbas, Abdullah Ibn Umar, Talha, Abdullah Ibn Masood, Abu Hurairah, Anas Ibn Malik, Abu Saeed Khudri, Umme Habiba and Umme Salma.

From this statement of Ibn Khaldoon, it is absolutely clear that all Muslims, irrespective of the sect they belong to, believe in the reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) in the last era. So, the question arises that if all Muslims, irrespective of the sect they belong to, believe in the reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) in the last era, his rule, his spreading of justice and equity in the entire world, then why don’t all Muslims accept the Imamate and Mastership of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) today!

We pray to Allah that He hastens the reappearance of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) and gives us the opportunity to spend our lives in his just kingdom whilst being steadfast on his Imamate and Mastership.

Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!

title.rendered: Light of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) on the Night of Ascension (Me’raaj)

content.rendered:
The famous Ahle Tasannun traditionalist, Ibrahim al-Hamveeni writes in his book Faraaed al-Simtain, vol. 2, p. 319, H. 571 that Abu Sullami who was a slave of the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.a.) and his horseman states that I heard the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.a.) saying,

“The night I ascended to the heavens (Me’raaj), Allah, Mighty be His Might, mentioned to me about Surah Baqarah (2): Verse 285

آمَنَ الرَّسُولُ بِما أُنْزِلَ إِلَيْهِ مِنْ رَبِّهِ

“The Apostle believes in whatever has been revealed to him from his Lord”

Upon this, the Holy Prophet (s.a.w.a.) said, وَ الْمُؤْمِنُونَ which means “so do the believers”.

Then Allah said, “You are right, O Muhammad! Who have you appointed as a caliph in your nation?”

Holy Prophet (s.a.w.a.) replied, “The one who is the best among them.”

Allah said, “Ali Ibn Abi Talib”

The Holy Prophet (s.a.w.a.) replied, “Yes, my Lord.”

Then Allah addressed him (s.a.w.a.) and said, “I glanced upon the earth and chose you among others for Me and assigned for you a name from among My Names. Hence, whenever I am remembered, you will be remembered with Me. I am Mahmood and you are Muhammad. Again, I glanced at the earth and chose Ali and assigned for him a name from among My Names.

I am A’laa (The Most-High) and he is Ali. O Muhammad! I created you and created Ali, Fatima, Hasan, Husain, and the 12 Imams from their progeny from My light and presented your Mastership to the people of the heavens and the earth. So, whosoever accepted it is a believer near Me and whoever rejects it, is an apostate near Me.

O Muhammad! If any of My servants worships Me to the extent that he becomes as thin as a wire and comes to Me in a state that he has not accepted your mastership, I will not forgive him until he accepts the mastership of you all. O Muhammad! Would you like to see them (the 12 Imams)?”

The Holy Prophet (s.a.w.a.) said that I replied, “Yes, my Lord.” So, Allah asked me to look towards the right side of the Divine Empyrean (Arsh) and as soon as I turned, I saw Ali with me and Fatima, Hasan, Husain, Ali Ibn Husain, Muhammad Ibn Ali, Jafar Ibn Muhammad, Moosa Ibn Jafar, Ali Ibn Moosa, Muhammad Ibn Ali, Ali Ibn Muhammad, Hasan Ibn Ali and Mahdi standing upright in the state of prayer in oceans of light, and Mahdi was like a luminous star among them.

Then Allah said to me, “O Muhammad! These are My Proofs and he i.e. Mahdi, is the avenger of the blood of your progeny. I swear by My Honor and Majesty, he is the Obligatory Proof upon My friends and the avenger from My enemies.”

We pray to our Lord that He hastens the reappearance of His Obligatory Proof, Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) whose light was shown to His Beloved Prophet (s.a.w.a.) on the night of ascension (Me’raaj) and include us among his friends and those who are steadfast upon his Imamate. Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!

title.rendered: Caliphate of Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.) in the Holy Quran

content.rendered:
Allah, Mighty and Majestic be He, says in Surah Noor (24): Verse 55 of the Holy Quran

Allah has promised to those of you who believe and do good that He will most certainly make them rulers in the earth as He made rulers those before them, and that He will most certainly establish for them their religion which He has chosen for them, and that He will most certainly, after their fear, give them security in exchange; they shall serve Me, not associating aught with Me; and whoever is ungrateful after this, these it is who are the. transgressors.

In the light of this verse, every Muslim must think and ponder that Allah, the Almighty, has made certain promises to the believers and good-doers.

1st Promise: Almighty Allah shall make them rulers in this entire earth. According to Ahle Tasannun, this verse is applicable to every ruler and caliph in Islamic history. If we accept this view of the Ahle Tasannun then it would also include Yazid Ibn Muawiyah in this list of rulers and caliphs although a majority of the Muslims consider Yazid and his likes to be accursed. Pondering over this verse, we will realise that the word used therein is ‘earth’ which obviously refers to the entire world. It cannot be limited to Makkah, Madinah, Hejaz, Iraq, or other Islamic countries currently because these are a part of the earth, not the entire earth. Hence, right from the initial period of Islam till date, history has never witnessed a moment wherein a divine caliph ruled the entire world or Islam being the dominant religion.

2nd Promise: Allah, the Exalted, will establish that religion with which He is satisfied. The famous Ahle Tasannun scholar Ibn Jauzi in his book Zaad al-Maseer, vol. 6, p. 58 narrates that the word ‘religion’ in this verse refers to Islam and establishing means Islam’s domination and success over all other religions. However, to date, Islam has never been able to dominate over other religions as the only practiced religion. Now, it is the responsibility of every Muslim to know about that religion with which Allah is satisfied because our eternal fortune is dependent on that very religion with which Allah is pleased. Keeping emotions aside, every Muslim must think in the light of intellect as to which is Allah’s chosen religion. A religion which was perfected in Ghadeer with the announcement of the Imamate and Mastership of 12 Imams i.e., Imam Ali (peace be upon him) and his 11 successors (peace be upon them). A religion that is certified in the Holy Quran or some other religion that has no relation to Ghadeer?

3rd Promise: Exchange the fear of the believers with security.

4th Promise: Only Allah will be worshipped on earth and there will be no trace of polytheism.

At present, the vast majority of polytheists and disbelievers, through widespread injustice and tyranny, have created an environment of fear and anxiety. It means that every Muslim will vouch for the fact that all the promises made by Allah in this verse are yet to be fulfilled. But, being a Muslim, it is our firm belief that each of these divine promises shall definitely be fulfilled. But this is possible at the hands of only one man, the last successor of Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) i.e. His Eminence Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.).

Hence, we earnestly pray to the Almighty Allah, that in order to spread the religion of Islam in this entire world and establish peace and harmony, hasten the reappearance of His last proof and true caliph, His Eminence Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.), and keep us steadfast on the belief in his Mastership.

Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!

title.rendered: The Similitude of Holy Kaaba

content.rendered:
The epochal incident of the Red Sea parting at the instance of Prophet Musa (peace be upon him) paled in comparison when the impregnable walls of Holy Kaaba split to make way for Lady Fatema bint Asad (peace be upon her) so that she can deliver her child who was named Zaid by his father (peace be upon him), Haider by his mother (peace be upon her) and Ali by Almighty Allah.

The incredible crack in the walls of Kaaba on the historical date of 13th Rajab, on the 30th year of the Elephant, marks the incident of the birth of Ameerul Momineen Imam Ali (peace be upon him) within the holy precincts of the sacred house of Allah. Lady Fatema bint Asad (peace be upon her) emerged three days after the delivery of the newborn and handed over the infant in the eagerly waiting arms of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny). The child opened his eyes to gaze at the radiant visage of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny).

The sacred stature of the Holy Kaaba is indisputably evident in the Islamic world. Muslims desire to visit the Holy House of Allah at least once in their lifetime. The glorious cube-like structure was constructed at the divine command by the revered chosen apostles of Allah (peace be upon them). For the Islamic world, Holy Kaaba symbolizes profound love and affection in their hearts. Allah enhanced the attachment of Muslims towards His house by facilitating the birth of Ameerul Momineen, Imam Ali (peace be upon him), His chosen friend and successor to the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) by tearing the walls of His house asunder. Thus, highlighting the unique relationship between Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) and the Holy Kaaba.

We shall now analyze and describe the distinctive parallel between the stature of Holy Kaaba and the sublime status of Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him).

The birth of Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) in Holy Kaaba has no precedent.

As a matter of consensus, Muslim sects are unanimous that Ameerul Momineen, Imam Ali Ibn Abi Talib (peace be upon them both) had been the only one to have been born inside Kaaba. Neither before him nor after him, was any child given birth in the four walls of the sacred edifice.

Renown Ahle Tasannun scholar, who hails from Al-Azhar University in Cairo, Shaikh Momin ibn Hasan Momin Shablanjihas recorded in his book Noor al-Absaar Fee Manaqeb Aal Nabi al-Mukhtar (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) on page 154 right at the beginning of the biography of Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him).

لَمْ يُوْلَدْ فِي الْبَيْتِ أَحَدٌ قَبْلَهٗ سِوَاهُ

No child was born in the House (of Allah) before him

2) Ameerul Momineen, Imam Ali (peace be upon him) is singularly similar to that of Holy Kaaba.

The other fascinating aspect of the persona of Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) is that he was not just born in Holy Kaaba but for all intent and purposes he was also likened to the sacred House in its stature and reverence.

“…The example of Ali (peace be upon him) among you is like the Holy Kaaba. Which is enveloped with a cover, looking at it is worship and visiting it for Hajj is mandatory.”

The likeness of Ameerul Momineen, Imam Ali (as) to Kaaba is a topic that was extensively reported by scholars in their various books and there is no difference of opinion on the factuality of the concept. Stalwarts among Muslim scholars have recorded scores of traditions with a slight difference in the text but essentially with the same crux of the matter.

Here are a few names of the highly reputed and renowned Ahle Tasannun scholars who recorded this tradition in their authoritative research works. This includes Ibne Asakir in his magnum opus Tarikh Damishq vol 42, pg 356 has quoted the tradition verbatim, while Ibne Maghazili in his book Manaqeb Ameeril Momineen Ali Ibn Abi Talib (peace be upon them both) vol 1, pg 164 has reproduced it with slight variation. Nevertheless, Abu Shuja Dailami in his Al-Firdous Be Mathoor al-Khetaab in vol 5 pg 315.  Hamavi Shafei in Ghaayat al-Maaram vol 1 and pg 72. Hisaamud Deen Hanafi has recorded in Aal Mohammad vol 1 pg 624 and Ibn Athir in his book Usd al-Ghabah fee Marefat al-Sahaba vol 4, pg 102

3) The Remembrance of Imam Ali (as) is worship:

The merits and excellences of Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) recorded in books are simply inexhaustive. Even staunch scholars of the Ahle Tasannun, cannot shy away from including those exquisite narrations regarding Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) and his magnificent position. Ayesha, a diehard detractor of Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) quoted the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) that

“Remembrance of Ali is an act of worship.”

The narration has found its place in several tomes of Ahle Tasannun scholars including Ibne Asakir in Tarikh Damishq vol 42, pg 356, Muttaqi Hindi in Kanzul Ummal fi Sunanul Aqwal wal Afaal vol 11, pg 601, Shaikh Suleman Qundoozi in his celebrated work Yanabi al-Mawaddah le Dhawi al-Qurba vol 2 pg 76.

Gazing at Holy Kaaba is a virtuous act and similarly remembering Ameerul Momineen, Imam Ali (peace be upon him) is an act of worship and has amazing rewards. If looking at Kaaba refreshes heart, discussing the excellence of Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) rejuvenates faith.

Just to summarize our discussion briefly as follows:

  • The excellences of Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) are supremely exclusive and none has reached even close to it, for instance his exceptional birth in the sanctum sanctorum of Holy Kaaba.
  • Ameerul Momineen, Imam Ali (peace be upon him) enjoys a unique position of reverence equivalent to that of Holy Kaaba which none of the companions of the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) can be ascribed with. Consequently, the respect of Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) becomes obligatory on every Muslim as is the veneration of Holy Kaaba.
  • Superseding Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) by someone else is like giving preference to some other structure over the Holy Kaaba.
  • The Holy Kaaba being a vortex of worship, the believers throng the sacred House of Allah. The Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) has emphasized on his nation that the Holy Kaaba will not go to people rather people should visit the Holy Kaaba. Nevertheless, and without any ambiguity, the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) has proclaimed that Muslims should swear allegiance to Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) and submit to his mastership by approaching him and not expecting him to seek allegiance by going to their doorsteps. It is delusional to hope that we can perform Hajj in our homes, that the Holy Kaaba will come to our house. Similarly having such fallacious thoughts of Ameerul Momineen (peace be upon him) seeking their loyalty by going to them are clearly erroneous.
  • Just as people look at the Holy Kaaba and seek its benefits in this world and in the hereafter, so also Ameerul Momineen, Imam Ali (peace be upon him) is the source of success in this world and in the hereafter.
  • Opposition or hostility to Ameerul Momineen, Imam Ali (peace be upon him) is like desecration of the Kaaba and whoever does so will be at a loss in the hereafter and will be liable for punishment. Only he can dare to detract with Ameerul Momineen, Imam Ali (peace be upon him) who does not have the love of the House of Allah in his heart.

Today, the focal point of the Muslim nations is to face the Holy Kaaba as their Qibla and Muslims are united in this act of righteousness. Not just for prayers but for every religious act Muslims turn towards Holy Kaaba. It is an important moment for Muslims to deliberate and unite under the guardianship and leadership of their spiritual and real Kaaba, Ameerul Momineen, Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib (peace be upon them both) and the Holy Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) and thus express their obedience to God Almighty completely.

Our heartfelt congratulations to all the devotees of Ameerul Momineen, Imam Ali (peace be upon him) on this joyous occasion. We beseech Allah to hasten the reappearance of Imam Mahdi (peace be upon him) who is the successor of Ameerul Momineen, Imam Ali (peace be upon him) and Kaaba of our times.

Ameen, O Lord of the worlds!

title.rendered: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.a.) informed about the Martyrdom of Fatima Zahra (s.a.)

content.rendered:
Ibn Abbas narrates that the Messenger of Allah (s.a.w.a.) informed us about his daughter Fatima Zahra (s.a.) in a lengthy tradition:

“My daughter Fatima, is the chief of the women of the worlds, from the first till the last ones. She is a part of me, the light of my eyes and the coolness of my heart. She is my soul which is in my body. Rather, she is a human Hourie. When she stands in her prayer niche, in front of her Lord, Mighty be His Majesty, her light shines for the angels in the sky just as the stars shine for the people on the earth. Then Allah, Mighty and Majestic be He, addresses His angels, ‘O My Angels! Look at My maid Fatima, the chief of all My maids. When she stands in front of Me, she trembles in My fear and she has turned towards My worship with the bottom of her heart. I make you all as witnesses that I will most surely grant amnesty to her followers (Shias) from the Hell-fire.’”

Then Holy Prophet (s.a.w.a.) informed about the atrocities upon his daughter thus:

“Whenever I look at her, then I am reminded of all that will befall her. As if I can see wretchedness entering her house, she will be disrespected, her rights will be usurped, she will be deprived of her inheritance, her ribs will be broken and she will suffer a miscarriage. She will call out ‘O Muhammad (s.a.w.a.)!’ But none will reply to her. She will raise a cry for help but no one will come to her aid. She will then always remain grief-stricken, troubled, lamenting. Sometimes she will be reminded of the discontinuation of Divine Revelation from her house. At other times she will miss me. At night, she will feel lonely because now she will not be able to listen to my voice which she could when I used to get up at night for prayers and recite the Holy Quran in it. And now she will find herself in a state that she is not respected anymore whereas earlier she was respected at the time of her father. At that time, Allah, Exalted be His Remembrance, will console her along with the angels just like He consoled Maryam Bint Imraan (s.a.). The angels will say, ‘O Fatima (s.a.)!’

إِنَّ اللهَ اصْطَفاكِ وَ طَهَّرَكِ وَ اصْطَفاكِ عَلى‏ نِساءِ الْعالَمِينَ‏

“Indeed, Allah has selected you, kept you pure and chosen you over the women of the worlds.”
[Surah Aal Imraan (3): verse 42]

‘O Fatima (s.a.)!’

اقْنُتِي لِرَبِّكِ وَ اسْجُدِي وَ ارْكَعِي مَعَ الرَّاكِعِينَ‏

“Pray to your Lord, prostrate and bow along with the bowing ones.”
[Surah Aal Imraan (3): 43]

When she will fall ill, Allah, Mighty and Majestic be He, will send Maryam Bint Imraan (s.a.) to her to attend to her and console her. At that time, she (my daughter Fatima (s.a.)) will plead,

يَا رَبِّ إِنِّي قَدْ سَئِمْتُ الْحَيَاةَ وَ تَبَرَّمْتُ بِأَهْلِ الدُّنْيَا فَأَلْحِقْنِي بِأَبِي

‘O my Lord! I am tired of life and I am fed up of the people of this world. You join me with my father (i.e. grant me death)!’ So Allah, Mighty and Majestic be He, shall unite her with me and she will be the first one among my Ahlul Bait (a.s.) to unite with me. She will come to me in a state that she will be sorrowful, troubled, aggrieved, her rights will be usurped and she will be killed. Then I will say,

اللَّهُمَّ الْعَنْ مَنْ ظَلَمَهَا وَ عَاقِبْ مَنْ غَصَبَهَا وَ ذَلِّلْ مَنْ أَذَلَّهَا وَ خَلِّدْ فِي نَارِكَ مَنْ ضَرَبَ جَنْبَيْهَا حَتَّى أَلْقَتْ وَلَدَهَا

‘O Allah! Curse the one who oppresses her! Punish the one who usurps her rights. Humiliate the one who tries to insult her and keep the one who hit her ribs until her son was still-born, forever in the Hell-fire.’ The angels will say, ‘Aameen!’

Reference: Behaar al-Anwaar, vol. 43, pp. 172-173, H. 13 narrating from Al-Amaali of Shaikh Saduq (a.r.)

Note:
▪︎ One cannot imagine the condition of Holy Prophet (s.a.w.a.) when he was narrating to Ibn Abbas about the atrocities upon that daughter whom he himself had named ‘Umm Abeeha’ (mother of her father) and who was a part of him.
▪︎ That pain can only be felt by the Imam of the time who is waiting in occultation (Ghaibah).
▪︎ All we can do is pray that

یَا رَبَّ فَاطِمَةَ، بِحَقِّ فَاطِمَةَ، اِشْفِ صَدْرَ فَاطِمَةَ، بِظُهُوْرِ الْحُجَّةِ

‘O Lord of Fatima (s.a.)! By the right of Fatima (s.a.)! Pacify the heart of Fatima (s.a.), through the reappearance of (Imam) al-Hujjah (a.t.f.s.)!’

Aameen! O Lord of the worlds!

She is a part of me, the light of my eyes and the coolness of…

title.rendered: The Noblest of all Actions

content.rendered:
إِنَّ أَشْرَفَ أَعْمَالِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ فِي مَرَاتِبِهِمُ الَّتِي قَدْ رُتِّبُوا فِيهَا مِنَ الثَّرَى إِلَى الْعَرْشِ
الصَّلَاةُ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ وَ آلِهِ الطَّيِّبِينَ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِمْ
وَ اسْتِدْعَاءُ رَحْمَةِ اللهِ وَ رِضْوَانِهِ لِشِيعَتِهِمُ الْمُتَّقِينَ
وَ اللَّعْنُ لِلْمُتَابِعِينَ لِأَعْدَائِهِمُ الْمُجَاهِرِينَ الْمُنَافِقِينَ

His Eminence Imam al-Hasan al-Askari (peace be upon him) said:

The most noble of the actions of believers concerning their grades which they will obtain from the core of the earth till the Divine Throne (Arsh) are

(Sending) Salutations upon Muhammad and his pure progeny, may Allah’s salutations be upon them all

Praying for the Mercy of Allah and His Satisfaction for their pious Shias

And cursing the followers of their open and hypocritical enemies

Notes:

  • Nobility as a status and a title is desired for by everyone.
  • However, merely calling oneself by this title or people considering someone to be noble does not guarantee this status.
  • A truly noble person near Allah is he who is noble in the light of the traditions of the Ahlul Bait (peace be upon them). His status would be decided basis this only.
  • It means, as per this tradition, true nobility is in sending salutations upon Prophet Muhammad and his progeny, praying for their pious Shias, and cursing the followers of their enemies.

May Allah, the Almighty, grant us the good fortune of acting upon the teachings of the progeny of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) and hasten the reappearance of their last representative, the Imam of our time, His Eminence Imam al-Mahdi (a.t.f.s.). Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!

References:

  1. Tafseer Imam Hasan al-Askari (a.s.), p. 591
  2. Behaar al-Anwaar, vol. 91, p. 62, H. 49
  3. Mustadrak al-Wasaael, vol. 5, p. 240

title.rendered: Jabir Ibn Abdullah Ansaari – The First Visitor of Arbaeen

content.rendered:
A’amash relates from Atiyyah al-Kufi, who was a slave of Jabir Ibn Abdullah Ansaari (r.a.), that he says,

“I accompanied Jabir Ibn Abdullah Ansaari for the pilgrimage to the grave of Imam Husain Ibn Ali Ibn Abi Talib (a.s). When we entered Karbala, Jabir went towards the river Euphrates, performed the ritual bath (Ghusl), wrapped himself in a cloth, and placed a robe upon his shoulders (like the Ehraam of Hajj). Then he opened a purse of a So’d (a perfume) and applied it upon his body. He then started glorifying Allah at each step until he reached the grave, then he told me, ‘Tie me to the grave’. So, I tied him to the grave. Then Jabir threw himself on the grave and fell down unconscious. I sprinkled some water upon him. When he regained consciousness, he cried out thrice ‘O Husain, O Husain, O Husain!’ Then he said,

حَبِيبٌ لَا يُجِيبُ حَبِيبَهُ

‘A friend is not replying to his friend?’ Then he said,

‘How could he reply when the blood of his jugular vein lies smeared upon his throat, while his head has been separated from his body! I bear witness that you are the son of the last of the Prophets (s.a.w.a.), son of the chief of believers and the companion of piety. You are the son of guidance and the fifth among the people of the cloak. You are the son of the leader of all leaders and the son of Fatima, the chief of all women. And why would it not be so, when you have been fed by the hands of the chief of all Messengers (s.a.w.a.) and brought up in the laps of the pious, you were fed with the milk of faith and you grew up along with Islam. You lived a pure life and died in chastity as well. But the hearts of the believers are aggrieved due to your separation while they have no doubt in your fruitful end. Thus, salutations of Allah and His Paradise be upon you! I bear witness that you tread the path similar to your brother Yahya Ibn Zakariyyah (a.s.)’. Then Jabir turned his eyes around the grave and said,

السَّلَامُ عَلَيْكُمْ أَيَّتُهَا الْأَرْوَاحُ الَّتِي حَلَّتْ بِفِنَاءِ الْحُسَيْن وَ أَنَاخَتْ بِرَحْلِهِ ‏

‘Peace be upon you, O the souls which sacrificed themselves for Husain (a.s) and submitted to him with their mounts!

وَ أَشْهَدُ أَنَّكُمْ أَقَمْتُمُ الصَّلَاةَ وَ آتَيْتُمُ الزَّكَاةَ وَ أَمَرْتُمْ بِالْمَعْرُوفِ وَ نَهَيْتُمْ عَنِ الْمُنْكَرِ وَ جَاهَدْتُمُ الْمُلْحِدِينَ وَ عَبَدْتُمُ اللَّهَ حَتَّى أَتَاكُمُ الْيَقِينُ

I bear witness that you established the Prayers, you gave the Zakaat, you enjoined the good, forbade evil, fought against the deviated ones, and worshipped Allah until death approached you.

Jabir continued, ‘By Him Who sent Muhammad (s.a.w.a.) as a Prophet with truth, we are indeed partners with you in whatever you have achieved’. Atiyyah says that hearing this I asked, ‘O Jabir! How are we partners with them, when we did not alight at any valley or ascend a mountain, nor did we strike anyone with swords? While the heads of these martyrs were severed from their bodies, their children have been orphaned and their women have been widowed?’

Jabir replied, ‘O Atiyyah! I have heard my beloved, the Prophet of Allah (s.a.w.a.) say that those who love a nation shall be raised along with them, while those who are pleased with the action of a group is party to them in their task. By the One Who sent Muhammad (s.a.w.a.) with truth as a Prophet! My intention and those of my companions is similar to what Imam Husain (a.s.) passed away with. Now, take me to the houses of Kufa’.

Atiyyah narrates that ‘we had covered only a short distance when Jabir said, ‘O Atiyyah! Should I advise you something because I do not think that I shall meet you again after this journey? Befriend the friends of the progeny of Muhammad (s.a.w.a.) till they continue to befriend them! And bear enmity with the enemies of the progeny of Muhammad (s.a.w.a.) until they continue to bear enmity with them even if he fasts the whole year and remains awake at night (in worship). Be merciful towards the friends of the progeny of Muhammad (s.a.w.a.), for if one of their feet slips due to excessive sins, the other one will remain steadfast due to their love. Their friend shall return to Paradise and their enemy will return to Hell.’

References:
1. Bashaarah al-Mustafa Le Shia al-Murtaza, vol. 2, pp. 74-75
2. Behaar al-Anwaar, vol. 65, pp. 130-131, H. 65 & vol. 98, pp. 195-196, H. 31

Note:

This was the first Ziyaarat of Imam Husain (a.s.) and the honour of being the first visitor went to Jabir Ibn Abdullah Ansaari. Our salutations to Jabir and we feel like telling Jabir that O Jabir, then it was you alone who performed this Ziyaarat but come and witness the radiance of Karbala today. Lovers of the progeny of Muhammad (s.a.w.a.) – from all parts of the world, to express their love, defeating every fear and bearing every pain – throng towards Karbala on Arbaeen, so that practice which you established continues till Qiyaamah.

Lastly, in order to implement the advice of Jabir Ibn Abdullah Ansaari, we beseech Allah to grant us the sustenance to love the lovers of the progeny of Muhammad (s.a.w.a.), hate their enemies and in order to establish the rule of the progeny of Muhammad (s.a.w.a.) in the entire world, hasten the reappearance of the Imam of our time, His Eminence Imam Mahdi (a.t.f.s.). Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!

title.rendered: Respecting the soil of Karbala – Incident of brother of Muhaddith Noori (r.a.)

content.rendered:
Shaikh Abbas Qummi (r.a.) in his famous and accepted book Mafaateeh al-Jinaan under the chapter on the benefits of the soil from the holy grave of Imam Husain (a.s.) records an incident that his teacher, the most reliable scholar of Islam (Thiqah al-Islam), Mohaddith Noori (r.a.) has penned in his book, Daar al-Salaam:

One day my respected mother saw one of my brothers placing the soil of the grave of Imam Husain (a.s.) in the side pocket of his cloak. On seeing this, she scolded him and said,

“This is disrespect to that clay because by keeping it there, it (Sajdagaah) may get crushed and may break.”

My brother acknowledged that such a thing had already happened twice with him and he promised that he would never keep the clay (Sajdagaah) in his that pocket ever again.

Several days passed after this incident. One night, my respected father, the late Allamah, who was unaware of this incident, saw in a dream that our master Imam Husain (a.s.) had come to meet him and was seated in his library and was treating him with great affection. Then Imam (a.s.) said to my father,

“Call your sons so that I may grant them something.”

Then my father called all five of us brothers and we stood in his (a.s.) presence. Imam (a.s.) had some clothes and a few other things. He (a.s.) called each of us one at a time and gave some gifts to us. When it was the turn of that brother of mine, Imam (a.s.) looked at him with displeasure and said to my father,

“This son of yours has broken two Sajdagaah made from the soil of my grave.”

After saying this, Imam (a.s.), unlike for my other brothers whom he had called upon, threw something at my brother from afar, which I think was a box for keeping combs.

After this, my father woke up from his dream and narrated it to my mother and she, in turn, narrated that incident to my father. He was amazed at the veracity of the dream.

Dear mourners of Imam Husain (a.s.), the respect of the soil of the grave of Imam Husain (a.s.) is obligatory. Since this is not just the soil of the most superior land but as we found in this incident, Imam Husain (a.s.) is so sensitive about the soil from his grave such that he does not tolerate the slightest of negligence in this matter. Ibn Qulawayh (r.a.) in his book Kaamil al-Ziyaaraat has brought 5 chapters on the topic of the soil of Imam Husain’s (a.s.) grave in which he has recorded 34 traditions wherein he mentions that the soil is a source of cure and protection, manners of partaking from this soil and the prayers which should be recited before using this soil.

We pray to Allah that He may grant us the good fortune of being careful and respectful towards this soil and that we may train our children to be respectful towards it. Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!

title.rendered: Imam Reza (a.s.) commands cursing Yazid

content.rendered:
Whatever the family of Imam Husain (a.s.) was subjected to in Karbala, the tortures of Kufa and Syria were much more severe.

Ibn Ubdoos narrates from Ibn Qutaibah from Fazl Ibn Shazaan who said that I heard Imam Reza (a.s.) say:

“When the severed head of Imam Husain (a.s.) was brought to Syria, Yazid – may Allah curse him – ordered the head to be kept and a table cloth be spread over it. Then he and his companions began eating food and drinking alcohol. When they finished eating, Yazid (the accursed) ordered for Imam’s head to be placed on a tray kept beneath his throne and a chessboard is laid out over it. Then Yazid – may Allah curse him – sat down to play chess and he called out the names of Imam Husain (a.s.), his noble father Imam Ali (a.s.), and his grandfather Holy Prophet (s.a.w.a.) and was mocking at them. Whenever he defeated his companion in a game of chess, he drank alcohol thrice and spilt the remaining on a tray beneath him lying on the ground. Hence, whoever is from among our Shias, should refrain from drinking alcohol and playing chess. Whoever looks at alcohol or chess should remember Imam Husain (a.s.) and curse Yazid and the progeny of Ziyaad. Allah, Mighty, and Majestic be He, will erase his sins due to this even if they be equal to the number of stars.”

[Uyoon o Akhbaar al-Reza (a.s.), vol. 2, p. 22, H. 50 & Behaar al-Anwaar, vol. 45, p. 176, H. 23]

It is clear from this tradition of Imam Reza (a.s.) that consumption of alcohol, playing chess and mocking at Holy Prophet (s.a.w.a.) and his progeny (a.s.) is a characteristic of Yazid Ibn Muawiyah, the accursed. Hence, we pray to Allah by the right of Imam Husain (a.s.), help us the follow the advice of Imam Reza (a.s.) in this tradition such that whenever we see alcohol or chess, we remember the tragedy of Imam Husain (a.s.) and curse Yazid and the progeny of Ziyaad. And may this action of ours be a cause of the forgiveness of our sins. Aameen, O Lord of the worlds!
